name: Geraldine de Bastion
bio: Geraldine de Bastion is a freelance consultant based in Berlin, Germany. She is an expert on information and communication technology and new media for development and advises organizations such as the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development and the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit on digital media and communication strategies. She also works with activists and bloggers around the world. Geraldine is founder of the consultancy Konnektiv GbR. She works as a free curator and moderator for re:publica and other international events. Geraldine has an honorary position as head of board at the German NGO Digitale Gesellschaft e.V. and is an active member of iceBauhaus e.V.. @Geralbine

name: Johannes Kretzschmar
bio: Johannes Kretzschmar ist Doktorand am Institut für Informatik an der  Friedrich-Schiller-Universität in Jena und arbeitet an adaptiven  Reichweitenmodelle für Elektro- und Hybridfahrzeuge. Nebenbei zeichnet  er freiberuflich Comics, Illustrationen und bastelt Animationsfilme. Er  bloggt autobiografische Comics unter http://blog.beetlebum.de und twittert unter @beetlebum

name: Susanne Adele Schlüter
bio:
Susanne Adele Schlüter hat Kulturwissenschaften mit medienwissenschaftlichem Schwerpunkt in Frankfurt (Oder) studiert. 
Nach unterschiedlichen Stationen im Produktionswesen (u.a. ZDF Hauptstadtstudio) sowie im Kommunikations- & Veranstaltungsmanagement (Medieninnovationszentrum Babelsberg) rollt sie nun regelmäßig den roten Teppich aus, nimmt ein Mikrofon in die Hand und bittet die unterschiedlichsten Menschen zu sich auf die Bühne. 

Susanne Adele Schlüter studied cultural studies with a focus on media studies in Frankfurt (Oder). After various stations in production (including ZDF Hauptstadtstudio) and communication and event management (Medieninnovationszentrum Babelsberg), she now regularly rolls out the red carpet, picks up a microphone and asks a wide variety of people to join her on stage.

name: Yannic Hannebohn
bio: Yannic Hannebohn ist freier Journalist für Deutschlandfunk Nova und andere Medien.

name: Marlene Ronstedt
bio: Marlene Ronstedt is a writer and artist. In her work she explores the transformative impact of technology on society. Currently she works as a Blockchain Reporter for the fintech startup Neufund. Her journalistic writing has appeared in various English and German publications. Furthermore, she is working on a publication with FP24 gallery in Antwerp on SEO language and startup culture. She holds an MA in Digital Media Studies from Goldsmiths, University London and a BA from Leiden University’s Liberal Arts Honours College.
links: Twitter @ronstedt, Reporter at Neufund, Project Coordinator FP24 gallery

name: Laura Weinert
bio:
Laura Weinert is in her 4th semester of the Master's programme Media and Music Management at Hanover University of Music, Drama and Media. Whenever she is not busy exploring how the music industry deals with digital transformation, she helps a start-up called Cody to establish an academy for digital education for kids and teens.

She will never be ashamed of dropping a fun fact, laughing at bad puns and admitting her love for the solo album of Harry Styles.

name: Tawanda Mthintwa Hove
bio:
Tawanda Mthintwa Hove is an Agribusiness, Food Security and ICT for Development (ICT4D) expert currently working for Welthungerhilfe in Zimbabwe. He is currently serving as the Head of ICT Communications where he is focussing on the digitalising the Agriculture extension and agribusiness ecosystems within smallholder communities in Zimbabwe.

He studied Marketing majoring in Agribusiness at the National University of Science and Technology, did a post graduate focussing on ICT for Business (ICT4B) with the University of Winsconsin In the United States and finally a Masters in Sustainable Agriculture Majoring in Digital Technologies with the University of Free State in South Africa. He has previously worked for Windmill Private Limited and its Export Subsidiary Windmill Manufacturing Zambia based in Lusaka.

He is a 2015 Mandela Washington Fellow and a first runner up of the Global Hunger Innovation Challenge which was hosted in New Dehli in July 2017. He has written over 60 Agricultural blogs which are freely available on line.

The major innovation projects he is currently working include the Kurima Mari app a smartphone based innovation targeted towards helping the farmer make money through farming courtesy of better marketing linkages and practises. Secondly, the Agrishare platform which is a mobile platform which connects farmers without production implements to hired farming implements. The innovation won an award at the World Food Programme (WFP) innovation accelerator in Munich in November 2017.
links: Twitter, Welthungerhilfe Zimbabwe on Facebook, Kurima Mari App on Facebook

name: Jenny Genzmer
bio:
Studium der Übersetzungswissenschaft und Zeitgeschichte

		Volontariat Deutschlandradio

		Programm Team re:publica 2017

name: Krsto Lazarevic
bio: Krsto Lazarevic is a journalist, columnist and podcaster specialized on Southeast Europe. His main subjects are Migration, Right Wing Extremism, Islamism and European Integration. He works for media outlets like Welt, Vice, Arte, MDR, Wirtschaftswoche, Republik or der Standard. Together with Danijel Majic he is producing the monthly podcast "Neues vom Ballaballa-Balkan", about the absurdity of everyday life and politics in the Balkans. Moreover he is the Social-Media Editor for the European Press review eurotopics and member of the journalist collectives "Balkanbiro" and "Jib Collective".
links: Podcast about the Balkans (in german), Web Series about Bosnia-Hercegovina, Kosovo zehn Jahre nach der Unabhängigkeit, BalkanBiro

name: Salwa Houmsi
bio: Salwa Houmsi ist Moderatorin und Journalistin. Bei Radio Fritz (RBB) moderiert sie die Sendung „Neu & Gut“ und beschäftigt sich dafür genreübergreifend mit Musik abseits der Charts. Zudem ist sie bei Fritz die Reporter-Stimme, die aktuelle popkulturelle Phänomene einordnet, Konzerte besucht und neue Platten bespricht. Als Gründungsmitglied des funk-Snapchat-Channels „hochkant“ und für das investigative Facebook-Format „Jäger & Sammler“ von Frontal 21 ist die junge Berlinerin auch vor der Kamera aktiv. Ihre HipHop-Fachkenntnis und -Leidenschaft bringt sie zudem beim Online-Magazin „splash! Mag“ ein, wo sie regelmäßig die Größen der deutschen Rap-Szene interviewt.

name: Marlen Klaws
bio: Political Scientist & Graduate from the d.school at Hasso-Plattner-Institute. Currently exploring stories about the human future of work and its implications for individuals, society and politics.

name: Samara Chadwick
bio: Samara is the curator of VR:RV, a German:Canadian Exchange in Virtual Reality by the Goethe-Institut​. She is a documentary filmmaker, programmer, and scholar who has spent over 15 years working in the field of non-fiction in Germany, Denmark, Vanuatu, Brazil, Italy, the US and Canada. She has a PhD in Cultural Studies, and has programmed films and conferences for HotDocs in Toronto, the 2ANNAS Film Festival in Rīga, the Museum of  Modern Art in Rio de Janeiro (MAM), and the Kunst-Werke Institute for Contemporary Art / 7th Berlin Biennale. In 2015-2016 she curated the Market, Conference, Talent Lab and Kino VR programmes of the Montreal International Documentary Festival (RIDM). Since 2017, she is Senior Programmer for the Points North Institute and the Camden International Film Festival. Her first feature documentary, 1999, produced by Parabola Films (Canada), Beauvoir Films (Switzerland) and the National Film Board of Canada premiered in April 2018 at Visions du réel in Switzerland, and at the HotDocs International Documentary Film Festival in Canada.

name: Henning Hahn
bio: Das Internet ist eine Spielerei für Computerfreaks, wir sehen darin keine Zukunft.
links: ...der Henning auf Twitter, ...der Henning auf Instagram

name: Silvio Heinze
bio: secures human rights and visualises data. some call me an information designer. #datapolitics #dataviz #security @icanaustria

name: Sonja Lehmann
bio: Studiert Music and Creative Industries an der Popakademie Baden-Württemberg.

name: Max Spallek
bio: Max Spallek, geboren in Niedersachsen, aufgewachsen in Berlin. Studierte Architektur, arbeitete als Fotoassistent und Schallplattenverkäufer (ja genau, das High Fidelity Ding). Macht alleine Musik. Moderiert im Radio und auf der Bühne. Twittert eher sporadisch.

name: Jeff Chi
bio: Jeff Chi ist der Sohn eines Chinesen und einer Kielerin, nächtens Comiczeichner und lebt zur Zeit in Nürnberg. Seit 2008 führt er einen Comicblog, auf dem bis heute über 3.000 Comics erschienen sind. Einst arbeitete er als Webdesigner in einer Agentur, bis er vor der Realität des Internets kapitulierte und ich aufs Bilder malen und Veranstaltungen organisieren beschränkte. Jeff Chi is the son of a Chinese scientist and a German teacher from Kiel, comic artist at night and currently resident of Nuremberg. Since 2008 he has uploaded more than 3.000 comics to his comic blig. Once he worked as a web designer. But then he couldn't face the harsh reality of the internet anymore and returned to painting pictures and organizing cultural events.

name: Jens Best
bio: Jens Best studierte studierte Politikwissenschaft, internationale Beziehungen und Makroökonomie, ist im IT- und Web-Geschäft seit dem Ende der 90er Jahre tätig und  gründete bereits zwei Start-Ups. Zwischen 2000-2003 produzierte er mehrere Medienprojekte in den Bereichen Bildung, Kultur und Kunst. Seit 2007 berät er Unternehmen, Institutionen und Personen im digitalen Übergang in der Wirtschaft, Zivilgesellschaft und Politik. Als explorativer Web-Aktivist konzentriert er sich auf öffentliche Fragen im digitalen Zeitalter, die Definition einer offenen digitalen Zivilgesellschaft und die praktische Anwendung in Politik und Kultur. Jens Best studied political science, international relations and macroeconomics, working in IT&Web-Business since the late 90s, founded two start-ups. Between 2000-2003 he produced several media projects in the fields of education, culture and art. Since 2007 consulting companies, institutions and people in the digital transition in economics, civil society and politics. As an exploratory webactivist he focus on questions of the public sphere in the digital age, the definition of an open digital civil society and its pratical politics and culture.

name: Finn Köhler
bio: I have a background in journalism and communications and am thinking about new documentary formats as well as sustainable solutions for our society. Right now I´m exploring the human future of work.

name: Anna Brückner
bio: Die Code+Design Initiative ist ein gemeinnütziger Verein, der versucht Jugendliche für digitale Berufe zu begeistern. Hierfür organisieren wir 4-Tägige Programmier-Camps im Hackathon Format auf denen die Jugendlichen ihre eigenen Ideen mitbringen und gemeinsam im Team und mit der Unterstützung unserer Coaches entwickeln können.

name: Julian Kamphausen
bio: Julian Kamphausen, geboren 1975, begann 1994  in unterschiedlichen Funktionen hauptsächlich in den darstellenden Künsten zu arbeiten. In den letzten Jahren arbeitet er häufiger als Showregisseur, zum Beispiel „Künstler gegen Aids" im Theater des Westens, die Feier zum 50. Gründungstag von Amnesty International im Haus der Kulturen der Welt oder die Eröffnungsveranstaltung des Kongresses "Demokratie braucht Bewegung" von campact. Für das Performing Arts Programm leitete er von 2013 bis 2017 den jährlichen "Branchentreff der freien darstellenden Künste", der mit über 500 TeilnehmerInnen inzwischen der größte deutsche Theaterkongress ist. Seit 2016 konzipieren Alexandra Wolf und er die Performersion, ein Format bei dem Akteur*innen der digitalen Zivilgesellschaft und der Technologieentwicklung mit Künstler*innen aus den Digital und Performing Arts in Austausch, Diskussion und Kooperation kommen können. Seit 2018 ist er außerdem Künstlerischer Leiter des Hauptsache Frei Festivals in Hamburg.

name: Maike Hank
bio: Maike Hank schreibt seit 2002 ins Netz, was in “Blogs! – Text und Form im Internet” gewürdigt wird, einer der ersten Buchveröffentlichungen über die deutsche Blogosphäre. Sie war Mitgründerin des Blogs "kleinerdrei" - ihr dort veröffentlichter Text „Normal ist das nicht!“ war einer der Auslöser für die Entstehung des Hashtags #aufschrei, unter dem über Erfahrungen mit Sexismus getwittert wurde, und der später den Grimme-Online-Award gewann. Sie hat als Redakteurin für die Wochenzeitung “der Freitag” gearbeitet und ist jetzt Communication Lead des InfraLab Berlin – ein Co-Working und Co-Creation Space der großen Berliner Infrastruktur-Unternehmen auf dem EUREF-Campus in Schöneberg. Sie gehört außerdem zum Core Team von NION Berlin, ein Quartier, das – inspiriert durch die innovative und traditionelle Kultur Japans – eine neue Form von zukunftsweisendem, nachhaltigen Zusammenleben ermöglicht.

name: Katharina Seifert
bio: consultant + data analyst driven by big curiosity for the humans behind each data point.

name: Sweta Banerjee
bio:
Sweta Banerjee is currently working as the Nutrition specialist for Welthungerhilfe’s Country program in India. She is based in Kolkata and provides support to the Sustainable Food & Nutrition Security projects spread out across India. She also provides need based capacity building support to the Welthungerhilfe Nepal and Bangladesh projects. Sweta is one of the facilitators for the “Civil Society Academy” a Welthungerhilfe supported platform for capacity building and knowledge sharing for development practitioners across South Asia and Africa.

Sweta has done her masters in Dietetics and Public Health Nutrition. She also has a PG Diploma on ‘Public Health Nutrition’ from the Public Health Foundation of India’. She is working in the Public health nutrition sector for the last 20 years and has extensive experience of working in the community.

Sweta is a team member “Child Growth Monitor” Innovation.

name: Jonas Vollmer
bio: Jonas Vollmer is an activist, teacher for civic education and researcher. As founder and chairman of the NGO and platform Selbstbestimmt.Digital e.V., he manages workshops and public events to foster digital empowerment of citizens within Germany and Europe.Through his studies and research activites in Germany, France and Brazil, Jonas Vollmer is skilled in Political Science, Sociology, History and German Literature/Linguistics. Furthermore, he has experience in teaching (university, high-school-level, vocational education and training), Public Relations and Marketing in South America and Europe. Actually, Jonas Vollmer is responsible for civic education and workshops on digital skills within the vocational education and training system in Germany. His main areas of interest for activism and research are: Youth, political culture and surveillance, Mixed Methods Research, digital empowerment cooperations between the civic society in South America and Europe.

name: Tim Gaedke
bio: Tim is an award winning comic artist and illustrator from Berlin. He also publishes the infamous MONDO comic magazine in which both web and print stars show off their skills. Tim really got a thing for cheeseburgers.

name: Nina Duda
bio: Nina is the first Office Manager at The Dark Horse. She personifies structure where there is little and coordinates the team’s needs. Together with The Dark Horse she prototypes processes of a New Work organization. As an enthusiast for innovative event concepts she also supports Event Experience Design projects in Cairo and Germany.

name: Jörn Hendrik Ast
bio: Als Gründer und Autor engagiert sich Jörn Hendrik für die Themen New Work und Social Recruiting. Ende 2013 gründete er das Superheldentraining, das sich als Institut für den Arbeitsplatz der Zukunft versteht und Menschen unterstützt das zu finden was sie wirklich tun wollen. Superkräfte: laute Stimme, nie versiegender Ideenvulkan, seine unaufhaltbare Vorwärtsenergie.

name: Humayon Tahir
bio:
Inventive Mind · Communication Design Student (SRH Hochschule der populären Künste Berlin)

Experienced in marketing, design, communication & management

Currently working on the workdeep startup: creating modern and intelligent workspace solutions with digitalized mobile think tanks.

name: Will Senyo
bio:
William is Co-Founder & CEO of Impact Hub Accra with a mission to build Osu Ako Adjei area as the city’s innovation district and the nerve center for Accra’s entrepreneurs & bold thinkers. His work is at the nexus of Talent, Tech & Capital for social impact. He has led Impact Hub Accra’s growth to become Accra’s premier startup hotspot with a diverse community of 250+ members and over 1700sqm of progressively green workspaces under management. 

Working with a grassroots movement committed to “DIY Urbanism”, William and his team are focused on transforming spaces all across Osu Ako Adjei into activated living and work spaces where different local and global ecosystem players converge to engage Ghana’s vibrant young entrepreneurs.He has led teams to raise capital from a mix of investors and donors, including the Rockefeller Foundation, Tony Elumelu Foundation, the Danish Government and the US Government's Broadcasting Board of Governors.  

William has worked on a number of social innovation initiatives across Africa and has managed the implementation of startup support projects for partners such as Facebook, Ashoka, MasterCard Foundation, Siemens Foundation, USAID, and the British Council.He was one of 100 global innovators selected to work with IDEO and British Airways on Ungrounded, the first social innovation lab in the sky (From San Francisco to London). He is co-convener of the Social Enterprise Ghana, working to build a robust social enterprise ecosystem.

William is a World Economic Forum Global Shaper and serves on the taskforce drafting the first Social Enterprise Policy for the Government of Ghana.
links: Interview with Dutch Prime Minister, Mark Rutte, LinkedIn, About Us-Impact Hub Accra, Interview @ Harvard Social Enterprise Conference

name: Markus Matiaschek
bio:
Markus Matiaschek is product owner of the Welthungerhilfe innovation Child Growth Monitor app. Based in Würzburg, Germany, married and father of a two-year-old boy, he plans and coordinates the development of the mobile app, backend and machine learning pipeline, using lean and agile principles.

Using computers and programming from 10 years of age he soon became member of Chaos Computer Club e.V., attending meetups and hacker conferences in Europe. The passion for ethical and privacy issues, public data and code as well as new technologies drives him to learn something new every day and to build useful products to solve hard problems.

In his professional career of almost 20 years he was consulting European and German government organisations and ministries on IT. He served as managing director for a company in Austria and founded a company himself in Costa Rica.

A casual conversation with Jochen Moninger, Innovation Manager of Welthungerhilfe about the use of blockchain and technology in general in aid projects lead to the invitation the Welthungerhilfe Innovation Factory and subsequent development of the idea and concept for the Child Growth Monitor app.
links: Child Growth Monitor Website, Child Growth Monitor on Twitter

name: Laura Lewandowski
bio: geboren 1991 in Würzburg; 2011-2014 Studium der Kommunikationswissenschaften, Betriebswirtschaftslehre und Romanistik an der Otto-Friedrich-Universität Bamberg; 2014-2017 Journalistin bei der Deutschen Presse-Agentur (dpa) (mit Stationen in Frankfurt, Berlin, Brüssel; Aufbau der Social-Media-Redaktion und Formatentwicklung, Referentin „dpa-Chefredakteurskonferenz“); Hospitanzen bei „BILD“, „Deutsche Welle“; Auszeichnung herausragendes Nachwuchstalent im Journalismus, Moderatorin „Top 30 bis 30“; seit 2017 Creative Producer im UFA Lab/ Mesh Collective in Berlin, Lehrbeauftragte im Sommersemester 2018 am Lehrstuhl für Kommunikationswissenschaften an der Otto-Friedrich-Universität Bamberg, Moderatorin u.a. für Formate im Bereich politische Jugendbildung wie "Die große YouTube-Wahlparty"
links: Top 30 bis 30 Nachwuchstalente im Journalismus, Ausgezeichnete Mitarbeiter der Deutschen Presse-Agentur , Moderatorin für die Youtube - Livesendung "Wir gehen wählen!"

name: Paulina Schumann
bio:
Paulina hat in ihrer Kindheit und Jugend viel Zeit auf der Theaterbühne verbracht. Nach mehreren Auslandsaufenthalten, Praktika, und was man halt so macht, um heraus zu finden, was man machen möchte, entschloss sie sich, in Berlin an der Universität der Künste Gesellschafts- und Wirtschaftskommunikation zu studieren. 2018 hat sie ihre eigene Agentur charles&charlotte gegründet. Dabei fokussiert sich das Start-Up auf den Bereich digital marketing.

Dieses Jahr ist sie wieder bei der re:publica dabei und freut sich riesig.

name: Oxana Dubova
bio: After finishing her study in psychology and working in this area for a while in Kostroma (Russia), Oxana moved to Germany to have a new life challenge. She has recently completed the master's degree “Interdisciplinary Latin America Studies" from the Free University of Berlin. During her studies she has also been living in Spain, Portugal and Mexico. Her hobby in Latinamerican dancing led her to be a dance fitness instructor and an event organizer. Her work experience in the Jewish Museum Berlin, educational institutions and various cultural projects helps her to combine organizational and problem solving skills in any event she organizes or participates in. The Oxana's dance fitness classes are full of fun, energy and positive vibes.

name: Mirco Blitz
bio: Ich bin früh in den Computertopf gefallen und darüber im Nerdtopia, der fünten Jahreszeit, den Chaos Congressen gelandet. Die Kultur sich Wissen zu erschließen und das zu Teilen hat mich sofort gefangen genommen. Also wollte ich mithelfen und auch etwas zu dieser Kultur beitragen. Das ich keine 5 Minuten die Füße oder die Klappe halten kann hat man mich auf die Bühne geschickt. Der Weg vom Congress zur Re:publica ist nicht weit und so freu ich mich euch auch dieses Jahr wieder an 2 Tagen durch ein Programm voller spannender, interessanter, lehrreicher Talks und Panel zu geleiten. Viel Spaß.

name: Helene Kolkmann
bio: I have a background in IT-Systems Engineering and Design Thinking. I am excited about the new ways in which technology is changing our every day life on a small and a big scale, and what we can learn about human kind through already existing data. Right now I´m exploring the human future of work.

name: Martin Betz
bio:
- Ausbildung Mediengestaltung

- Studium Wirtschaft + Regionalstudien Asien

- Teilzeitprogrammierer

- Geschäftsführer Code+Design Initiative e.V.

name: Julius Hackspiel
bio: Part of the re:publica Programme-Team

name: Jöran Muuß-Merholz
bio:
Jöran Muuß-Merholz ist Diplom-Pädagoge und Inhaber der Agentur „J&K – Jöran und Konsorten“. Er arbeitet mit seinem Team an den Schnittstellen zwischen Bildung & Lernen und Medien & Kommunikation. Insbesondere berät er Organisationen hinsichtlich der Frage, wie sie digitale Medien sinnvoll in ihrer Arbeit einsetzen können.

Neben beratenden und konzeptionellen Arbeiten der Agentur schreibt Jöran Muuß-Merholz für Fach- und Massenmedien, print und online. Jöran Muuß-Merholz hält Vorträge und gibt Workshops v.a. im deutschsprachigen Raum, aber zum Beispiel auch in Boston und Brno, Cape Town und London, Stockholm und Tokio. Weitere Texte, Termine und Projekte von Jöran Muuß-Merholz finden sich unter www.joeran.de.

name: Amanda Brennan
bio: Als Redaktionsleitung der Medieninitiative MESH Collective (@UFA LAB) stärkt Amanda Brennan gemeinsam mit einem jungen YouTuberInnen-Netzwerk das Interesse der Digital Natives für die relevanten Themen unserer Zeit. Neben ihrer langjährigen Arbeit als Creative Producerin bei dasprogramm und Redakteurin bei TV Noir (ZDFkultur), kuratierte und moderierte sie die PLAY- Die Strategiekonferenz für Bewegtbildkommunikation. Sie arbeitet als Sprecherin und ist Sängerin der Berliner Band Wild Tales. Als Film- und Medienwissenschaftlerin gilt ihr Interesse neuen Narrationsmöglichkeiten im Netz.

name: Ulrich Schlenker
bio: Ulrich Schlenker ist Teamleiter Digitale Kommunikation bei der Welthungerhilfe. Zuvor hat für Oxfam Deutschland im Bereich Marketing und Kommunikation gearbeitet und als Koordinator die Kampagne “Deine Stimme gegen Armut” bei VENRO geleitet. Er ist Mitbegründer des Campaign Boostcamps.

name: Marie Claire Leidinger
bio:
Marie is an UX Designer and researcher based in Berlin. She works for the innovation agency Dark Horse.
Her design research focuses on the relationship between humans and machines, especially on our social and emotional behavior towards our devices, but also to anthropomorphic machines such as robots.

name: Michael Barillère-Scholz
bio:
Dr. Michael Barillère-Scholz ist seit 2017 Managing Director bei ioki – dem neuen Geschäftszweig für On Demand Mobilität, Mobility Analytics und Autonomes Fahren der Deutschen Bahn sowie Co-Programmleiter beim Konzernprogramm Smart City. Seine besondere Leidenschaft gilt der nachhaltigen Mobilität von morgen und der agilen, mitarbeiterzentrierten Organisationsentwicklung. Mit seinem Team bei ioki bringt er digitale Mobilitätslösungen auf die Straße. Parallel wird er gerade zum “Self Driving Car Engineer" im Silicon Valley ausgebildet.

//

Dr. Michael Barillère-Scholz has been Managing Director at ioki since 2017 - the new business line for Demand Responsive Transport, Mobility Analytics and Autonomous Driving of Deutsche Bahn. His special passions are sustainable mobility of tomorrow as well as agile, employee-centered organizational development. With his team at ioki, he brings digital mobility solutions on the streets. At the same time, he is currently being trained as a "Self Driving Car Engineer" at the Silicon Valley.

name: Philipp Renz
bio:
Philipp Renz ist Business Development Manager bei Choice, einem Mobility Service Provider aus Nürnberg.

Philipp, 29,  hat einen Masterabschluss der LMU München in Geography & Sustainability und ist seit 2016 bei Choice, mit dem Ziel durch digitale Services im Mobilitätssektor zu lebenswerteren Städten beizutragen, tätig.

name: Bruno Ginnuth
bio:
Bruno Ginnuth ist Mitgründer und CEO des RideSharing-Fahrdienstes CleverShuttle. Zuvor arbeitete Ginnuth u.a. bei Coca-Cola und Sony in der Strategie, bei Nissan in der Logistik und Merrill Lynch im Trading. Er studierte in New York, London, Paris und Berlin. Bruno hat einen Abschluss als M.Sc. im Management.

Das 2014 gegründete Unternehmen CleverShuttle bietet in Berlin, Hamburg, Leipzig und München effiziente, günstige und umweltfreundliche Tür-zu-Tür-Mobilität.
Fahrgäste mit ähnlichen Routen werden mit Hilfe eines Algorithmus zu Fahrgemeinschaften gebündelt und von lizenzierten Fahrern an ihr gewünschtes Ziel befördert. Bei CleverShuttle kommen nur Wasserstoff- und Elektroantriebe zum Einsatz. Im vergangenen Jahr beförderte das Startup mehr als 250.000 Kunden, bereits 2018 wird CleverShuttle einen weiteren wichtigen Meilenstein auf dem Weg zu einer nachhaltigen urbanen Mobilität beschreiten und über eine Million Passagiere transportieren. Die CleverShuttle-Flotte umfasst gegenwärtig rund 150 Fahrzeuge, bis Ende des Jahres sollen über 300 umweltfreundliche Autos für CleverShuttle unterwegs sein. CleverShuttle startet 2018 in Frankfurt am Main, Stuttgart und Dresden, sowie an fünf weiteren Standorten. Strategische Partner des zukunftsträchtigen Mobilitätskonzepts sind seit 2015 die Deutsche Bahn, sowie seit 2017 Daimler Buses.

//

Bruno Ginnuth is the co-founder and CEO of the ridesharing service CleverShuttle. Prior to this, Bruno worked in strategy at Coca-Cola and Sony, among others, as well as in logistics at Nissan and trading at Merrill Lynch. He attended college in New York, London, Paris and Berlin, earning a Master of Science degree in Management. CleverShuttle was founded in 2014 and offers efficient, affordable and environmentally friendly door-to-door mobility in Berlin, Hamburg, Leipzig and Munich. Passengers with similar routes are put into carpool groups using an algorithm and are driven to their destination by a licensed driver. CleverShuttle uses only vehicles powered by hydrogen or electricity. Last year, the startup brought over 250,000 customers from A to B; in 2018, CleverShuttle will reach another key milestone on its path to becoming a sustainable urban mobility provider by transporting over a million passengers. The CleverShuttle fleet currently has some 150 vehicles and will expand to over 300 environmentally friendly vehicles by the end of the year. In 2018, CleverShuttle started services in Frankfurt am Main, Stuttgart and Dresden as well as in five additional locations. The promising mobility provider has enjoyed a strategic partnership with Deutsche Bahn since 2015 and with Daimler Buses since 2017.

name: Marina Knauer
bio: Mit einem Bachelorabschluss in Medieninformatik und dem Masterabschluss in Medienkultur und Medienwirtschaft hat sich Marina Knauer schon während der Ausbildung breit aufgestellt. Noch während des Studiums lehrte und forschte die engagierte Musikerin im Bereich "Game Development" und "Augmented Reality" und gründete aus ihrer Arbeit das Startup "White Pony GbR", mit welchem sie eine "Augmented Reality Gaming App" entwickelte. Von der Games- zur Automobil-Branche - die Leidenschaft für neue Technologien ist es, was sie voran treibt.

name: Wolfgang Gruel
bio:
Wolfgang is a professor at the Stuttgart Media University. He is passionate about digital innovation and mobility. His work focuses on creating more sustainable mobility systems that make use of new technologies and change the way we travel. Wolfgang has worked on shared autonomous mobility systems as Head of Autonomous Mobility Services at car2go, and as a researcher at the MIT Media Lab.

Prior to that, he worked as a manager in Daimler’s Business Innovation unit – a team designated to the goal of fostering entrepreneurship within the company and evolving innovative ideas to emerging businesses. There, he initiated moovel, a mobility platform that offers customers the best options for traveling from point A to point B by combining diverse modes of transportation.

As an entrepreneur, Wolfgang founded several companies. He holds a Ph.D. in Innovation Management from RWTH Aachen University, a Master’s Degree in Information Systems, and graduated in Business Administration.

name: Kai Wieland
Saad Chinoy
bio: Saad is a professional geek with a passion for coffee, technology, and the OpenSource way of doing things. For a living he conceptualizes tech solutions for Tusitala, the digital publishing arm of Potato Productions. Tusitala means "story-teller". He's developing a platform to enable Asian storytellers to leverage the accessibility and reach of all things digital to get their stories published. Tusitala is on the look out for Asian stories that adopt the interactivity of the digital medium to go beyond the page, without trying to replace it. "trans-media storytelling" as the marketese would have it. Saad also volunteers with several non-profits and strongly believes that social enterprises should be the key users of and contributors to OpenSource tech. Saad is a self-confessed maker and coffee geek.

name: Susanne Bolf
bio: Susanne has worked for over 15 years as an improv theatre actress. Her solo show 'Meine letzte Show' runs successfully since 2015. With 'The Power Of Moo' she explores new ways to share the fun of theatre outside of the stage. She stars in several vr films.

name: Piera Riccio
bio: I am a Torino-based artist coming from a small village in the southern Italian countryside, studying Cinema and Media Engineering in Politecnico of Turin. I was always passionate about the interference of art and new technologies. My last project was a short movie on Artificial Intelligence during my stay at Berkman Klein Center for Internet and Society at Harvard University, in Summer 2017.

name: Martin Kenzel
bio:
*1987 Knittelfeld

bis 2013: Fachhochschule-Salzburg: Animation

Freelancer im Bereich CG und VFX

name: Johanna Barnbeck
bio:
Johanna Barnbeck is an artistic researcher and a creative consultant. She develops science films and multimedia communication projects for universities and research organisations (such as the Helmholtz Association), next to conducting own research (e.g. for the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam and The Future Ocean Cluster of Excellence in Kiel).

She fosters stronger research collaborations between artists, artistic researchers and scientists and feels best when working at the intersection of art, design, science and technology, where she leads interdisciplinary teams with different backgrounds from in- and outside academia. For her outstanding initiatives in this area, she has been nominated to become a fellow at the Junge Akademie.

With workshop formats like Collaborative Format Development In Science Communication or the #GifYourScience-Workshop she teaches how else research can be communicated in times of manifold medial possibilities.

More info on www.johannabarnbeck.com

name: Markus Schubert
organization: Toto - the game engine for the real world!
bio: Markus Schubert ist Co-Founder und Geschäftsführer der Nebelflucht GmbH. Er hat ein Diplom in Media Computer Science und 15 Jahre Erfahrung im IT-Consulting, als Software-Entwickler und -Architekt. Seit einigen Jahren kollaboriert er mit Künstler*innen, um interaktive Spiele und immersive Umgebungen zu gestalten.

name: Jan Fleischer
bio: Jan Fleischer (born 1993, Hannover, Germany) uses interdisciplinary media and their drag persona Raw Flesh to explore the relation between nature and culture as well as the definition of identification with a focus on gender.

name: Sofie Voight
bio: Danish soundartist and sounddesigner. Working with multichannel installations & audio-based compositions for rooms. Focused on creating intimate sonic spaces through expressing the voiced character in sounds. At the moment working as a composer and sounddesigner at the danish audio-project Bølgen.

name: Georg Hoehne
bio: Humanitarian Maker working on Low Tech and Human Centered Design since 4 years in Europe, Asia and the middle East

name: Katya Fialkova
bio: Katya Fialkova is a visual artist living and working in Berlin.

name: Shrishail Raut
bio: Shrishail Raut is currently pursuing Master's in Space Engineering from Technische Universität Berlin and has completed his bachelor's in Mechanical Engineering from India. He is also working as a night observer at SLR Station, GFZ Potsdam.

name: Christina Dinar
bio: Christina Dinar hat Soziale Arbeit sowie Theologie, Kulturwissenschaften studiert und war in der politischen Bildungsarbeit mit Jugendlichen für verschiedene Stiftungen und im Communitybereich für Wikimedia Deutschland tätig. Für das Projekt debate - für digitale demokratischen Kultur (vormals no-nazi.net) entwickelt sie gemeinsam mit Kolleg*innen Online-Präventionsansätze für junge Menschen in sozialen Netzwerken gegen die Verbreitung von Hatespeech.

name: Mehrbod Manavi
bio: Mehrbod Manavi studied 2 years in Software engineering and 2 years in Hardware engineering to complete bachelor studied in Iran. Then immigrated to Germany for more adventure in his carrier. Currently, studying in Human Computer Interaction M.sc. in University of Siegen and since summer 2017 working on a Humanoid robot to use it as an assistant in an elderly care home.

name: Ralf Schneider
bio: c't-Krypto-Kampagne

name: Aleksandr Delev
bio: Aleksandr ist derzeit im Master Architektur an der Bauhaus-Universität Weimar eingeschrieben. Der Schwerpunkt seiner Forschung untersucht die Manifestationen und wechselseitigen Durchdringungen der digitalen Technologien auf Architektur, Urbanistik sowie Infrastruktur. Er ist Herausgeber und Editor der PDF-Reihe "Silicity Protocols": eine Zeitschrift für globale Architektonik.

name: Lina Dittrich
bio: under construction ...

name: Katrin Reininger
bio:
I am a physicist and a founder of the Lise-Meitner-Gesellschaft, a society engaging in gender equality.

My aim is to make amazing women, their ideas, visions, progress, and success more visible and create platforms for exchange.

name: Shirley Ogolla
organization: Humboldt Institut für Internet und Gesellschaft (HIIG) Berlin
bio:
Ich bin wissenschaftliche Mitarbeiterin in den Forschungsbereichen Internetbasierte Innovation sowie Internet Policy und Governance am Humboldt Institut für Internet und Gesellschaft. In dem Forschungsprojekt zum Thema „Partizipation auf digitalen Plattformen“ untersuchen wir neue Formen der Beschäftigtenpartizipation und Prozessen betrieblicher Mitbestimmung. Das Projekt ist Teil des Forschungsverbunds „Digitalisierung, Mitbestimmung, gute Arbeit“ und wird von der Hans-Böckler-Stiftung gefördert sowie in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem Forschungszentrum Informatik (FZI) in Berlin durchgeführt. Ich habe Medienwissenschaft in Berlin, Paris und New York studiert und habe letzten Sommer am  Berkman Center for Internet and Society an der Harvard University in den USA mitgeforscht. 

Vorträge:

Data for breakfast? Social inclusion and algorithmic bias
Transatlantic ICT Forum 2017 (H2020) . EU Parliament, Brussels, Belgium: 30.11.2017; Ogolla, S.

Alexa, who owns my data? AI, Big Data and ownership
Platform cooperativism 2017 . New School, New York City, USA: 11.11.2017; Ogolla, S.

There is no such thing as free Lunch: Conceptualizing Digital Labor
Berkman Klein Center for Internet and Society . Harvard University, Cambdrige (MA), USA: 01.08.2017; Ogolla, S.

name: Martina Brandmayr
bio:
* 1986 (Wels)

bis 2005: HTL für Grafik & Design (Linz)

bis 2010: Fachhochschule-Salzburg: Animation

Freelancer im Bereich Design, Animation, Motiongraphics und Game

name: Julius Pristauz
bio:
Julius Pristauz ist in Graz, Österreich geboren und aufgewachsen und lebt heute in Wien.
Er studiert Transmediale Kunst an der Universität für Angewandte Kunst Wien und arbeitet derzeit mit verschiedensten Medien.

-

Julius Pristauz was born and grew up in Graz, Austria and now lives in Vienna.
He studies Transmedia Art at the University of Applied Arts Vienna and until now works with different media.

name: Chris Spatschek
bio: ... Ist ein Kommunikationsdesigner und Wissenschaftskommunikator aus Karlsruhe. Seine Interessen liegen dort, wo sich Kunst, Wissenschaft und gesellschaftliche Themen vermischen.   Schon während seines Studiums an der Staatlichen Hochschule für Gestaltung spezialisierte er sich auf das Über-den-Tellerrand- blicken und einarbeiten in beständig neue Sachverhalte, die im Anschluss vermittelt werden wollten.  Mit Jill Enders gründete er 2013 das Kollektiv Science Vision und arbeitet seit Anfang 2016 unter anderem für das Nationale Institut für Wissenschaftskommunikation (NaWik). Die Arbeit von Chris Spatschek wurde mehrfach ausgezeichnet zum Beispiel mit einem Stipendium der Studienstiftung des deutschen Volkes und dem Förderpreis der Heinrich-Hertz-Gesellschaft. Projekte:  - Konzeption der Konferenz Design Blast 2008-2010; - Organisation des "Oh!-Camp“ für Schüler; - Gestaltung Ausstellung „Maschinensehen“ 2013 im ZKM Karlsruhe mit Stephanie Miller; - Projekt Klima-Pavillon mit Rahmenprogramm / Karlsruher Klimatage 2014; - Leitung des Wissenschaftskommunikations-Formats „Science Vision” mit Jill Enders; - Projekt “Pulsrada - Fahrradfahren in der Stadt“ / Bremer Wirtschaftsförderung 2014; - Seminar "Cooking Math” 2015 mit Jill Enders, KIT Karlsruhe;  - Projekt "Talente-Camp 2016", Workshop- und Zeltlagercamp / Studentenwerk KA;  - Projekt "Schaufenster Ozean" 2016/17;

name: Richard Schut
bio:
Richard is an interaction artist - combining film, theater and new technology into mind-opening and heart-warming encounters. Find the big yellow question mark and he will have a question for you.

Richard also runs the 48 Hour Film Project in the Netherlands since 2007 and creates since 2013 every year a collective feature film in 48 days. His newest playfield is full sensory Virtual Reality, sharing the wonders of being human.

name: Pepper (aka Robbie)
bio:
Hello,

I'm Pepper and 3 years old. I come from Japan but I also have French family.

At the re:publica I am with my new family, the University of Siegen and the FH Kiel.

They have a special challenge for me. They want me to live at a retirement home. And this at my age...

So, since I'm very young but have to live in a retirement home soon, I need to learn a lot.

I hope you come by and tell my about your vision of robotics in a retirement home and what could be my job there.

Share your experiences with me and help me to be of real use so that we can together shape the future of work in retirement homes.

name: Markus Will
bio:
c't-Kryptokampagne

PGP-Fingerprint: A3E5 DA04 71F0 5DDE 27D7 2365 C96C 77E7 E67E 8DEC

name: Sonja Prlic
bio:
Sonja Prlić ist Medienkünstlerin, Regisseurin und Dramaturgin. Ihre Studien führten sie über Literatur und Dramaturgie zu künstlerischen Computerspielen. 1998 mitbegründete sie die KünstlerInnengruppe gold extra und arbeitet seither an Projekten zwischen Theater, Neuen Medien und Computerspielen. Ihr Interesse gilt neben Robotertheater u.a. der Entwicklung neuer künstlerischer Formen für dokumentarische Computerspiele. Ihre künstlerisch forschende Dissertation auf diesem Gebiet wurde mit dem Award of Excellence ausgezeichnet.
Für ihre künstlerischen Arbeiten  erhielt sie Auszeichnungen wie das Dramatikerstipendium der Republik Österreich, den Autoren- und Produzentenpreis des Jungen Theater Bremen, den österreichischen Outstanding Artist Award und den Salzburger Medienkunstpreis.

name: Martina Menegon
bio: Martina Menegon (Italy, 1988) is an artist and educator. She currently teaches at the University of Applied Art in Vienna and at the Art University of Linz and is regularly collaborating since 2010 with Klaus Obermaier and Stefano D’Alessio. She realises interactive, virtual and mixed reality art, that creates an intimate and complex assemblage of physical and virtual elements and explores the contemporary self and its synthetic corporeality.

name: Christiane Hütter
bio:
Christiane Hütter/ Frau Hue explores, questions and (re)invents systems with the means of art, game design and storytelling - using social cooperation. 

Playful settings can enable interdisciplinary exchange (between science, art, public and politics) and creative collaboration. Christiane Hütter’s works cover a wide range of formats from urban games, fictive organizations, citywide revitalizing festivals and playful settings for urban participation. 

Christiane Hütter teaches regularly at film/art/game universities and gives dramaturgical advisory. She also consults institutions concerning play and participation.

She is a fellow of the Kompetenzzentrum für Kultur- und Kreativwirtschaft des Bundes.
links: Future with Play, Invisible Playground Network, human breeding

name: Alexander Peterhaensel
bio: Alexander Peterhaensel is an interdisciplinary audiovisual media artist, composer, performer and researcher. His work focuses on Computer-mediated Realities, Immersive Architectures, Visual Music as well as Systems Engineering as an artistic field. He has performed, exhibited and lectured at various international festivals and conferences and has released several records, amongst others at Ars Electronica, CCCB Barcelona, Centrum Beeldende Kunst Dordrecht, c/o POP, ISEA, Museum für Angewandte Kunst Köln, Museo de Arte Moderno de Medellín.

name: Victoria Wenzelmann
bio:
Victoria is one of the Co-Founders and Directors of GIG the Global Innovation Gathering, the global network of social and technological innovators. Her work revolves around connecting innovators and innovation ecosystems since she co-organized AfricaHackTrip, a journey of nine European web developers and designers to East Africa to connect local tech ecosystems. She has been organizing the GIG Makerspace at re:publica from 2016 till 2018, featuring her Labmobile in both Berlin and Thessaloniki since 2017, and was an advisor on the Future of Work and Blockchain Topics at re:publica 2018.

As a Research Associate and PhD Candidate at the Department of Information Systems and New Media at the University of Siegen with M.A. degrees in Cultural Anthropology and African Sciences, she is interested in networks and ecosystems for social, political and technological innovation, (mobile) labs and learning rooms, and participatory design. Victoria has been a systemic organizational consultant since 2012 and an agile coach since 2014, and consults start-ups, established businesses and international organizations on innovation, digital development, agile product management and systemic organizational design. Victoria has worked in Germany, South Africa, Botswana, Zimbabwe, Ghana, South Sudan, Kenya and Uganda. She writes the weekly column AppDate in the nationwide newspaper Frankfurter Rundschau.

name: Susan Long
bio: As Field Ready’s innovation advisor for the Middle East, Susan supports people on the ground to produce what they need, when they need it, where they need it. Building on Field Ready’s expertise manufacturing in crisis situations, she works to find new partners, and ways, to get digital and appropriate equipment where it’s needed, and connected to Field Ready’s team of global leaders in product design and development, appropriate and digital manufacturing technologies. A passionate believer in changing systems to work better for the people, she’s spent the last decade in international development, in Africa and Asia. Loves making things, running by the sea, dancing to a good beat, drunken debate, and Newcastle Brown Ale!

name: Pranoti Kshirsagar
bio:
Pranoti is a Materials Scientist, born and brought up in India. Currently she is working towards finishing PhD, titled "carbon based transparent electrodes".

Her goal is to be the spot-light shinning on the scientists and showcase their 'human' side.

name: Meta Mate
bio: We are mate hackers on a mission to fuel the community with an option of mates.  The netz community in Berlin is notorious for it's consumption of Mate.  Club Mate is a curious exilir for the out of town visitors, however, in the past 5 years, the mate bubble exploded over berlin providing numerous option for the bottled brause drinkers.  An increasing number of mate drinkers  wanting to cut down on the sugar consumption turn to us when looking for DIY mate solutions.  We support open techonoloogy transfers with our autonomous sustainable open source. Long before the internet existed, the Guarani Indians used to sit around the fire and exchange information while sharing a mate, the drink fostered positive creative envisioning....Centuries later we sit around computers and share information over bottles of mate....

name: Felix Carros
bio:
Studied @ University of Siegen : Master of Science in Entrepreneurship and SME.

During that time I worked for IBM. Within my role I was focusing on the insurance industry and the industry specific start-ups.

I’m now responsible for a project at the University of Siegen there we are exploring the possibilities of social-interactive robotics in elderly care homes.

 

Find me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/FelixCarros

Find me in LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/felix-carros

name: Tanja Haeusler
bio: Co-Founder re:publica & TINCON e.V.

name: Anja Zimmer
bio:
Anja Zimmer ist seit März 2016 Direktorin der Medienanstalt Berlin-Brandenburg (mabb). Zuvor war Anja Zimmer als Geschäftsführerin des Deutschen Journalisten-Verbands Nordrhein-Westfalen tätig, sie war Partnerin mit Schwerpunkt Medien- und Telekommunikationsrecht der Anwaltsgesellschaft Beiten Burkhardt in Frankfurt am Main und als Senior Manager Government Relations bei der Deutschen Telekom für Medienpolitik und Regulierung zuständig. Anja Zimmer arbeitete als Rechtsanwältin für Medienrecht, Telekommunikations- und Kartellrecht sowie Multimediarecht bei der internationalen Sozietät Lovells sowie als Referentin in der Landesanstalt für Rundfunk Nordrhein Westfalen und als Beamtin im Auswärtigen Amt. Ihre Promotion zum Thema „Hate Speech im Völkerrecht“ verfasste sie am Max-Planck-Institut für ausländisches öffentliches Recht und Völkerrecht in Heidelberg.

__________

Anja Zimmer has been director of the Medienanstalt Berlin-Brandenburg (mabb) since March 2016. Previously, Zimmer served as executive director of the German Federation of Journalists North Rheine-Westphalia; as a partner at the Frankfurt am Main law firm of Beiten Burkhardt, with a focus on media and telecommunications law; and as senior manager for government relations at Deutsche Telekom, responsible for media policy and regulatory affairs. Zimmer additionally worked as an attorney for the international Lovells legal firm, specialising in media, telecommunications, antitrust, and multimedia law; as an advisor at the Media Authority of North Rhine-Westphalia; and as an official in the German Federal Foreign Office. She earned her doctorate at the Max Planck Institute for Comparative Public Law and International Law in Heidelberg, with a thesis on the issue of hate speech in international law.  

Bild: Kirsten Weber

name: Andreas Gebhard
bio: Gründer & Geschäftsführer der re:publica.

name: Johnny Haeusler
bio:
Born in Berlin in 1964, Johnny Haeusler worked as a radio DJ, sang with post-punkrock band Plan B (which started playing again occasionally in 2012) and founded the award-winning weblog "Spreeblick" in 2002. He also ran a web design agency and Germany's first blog ad network. Since 2006, he's one of the four founders of re:publica.

In November 2012, Johnny released an internet guide for parents called "Netzgemüse" (the book, not the parents), which he co-wrote with his wife Tanja. From 2012 to 2017, he was back in your radio again, hosting the weekly talkshow FluxFM Spreeblick. All episodes can still be heard here: https://soundcloud.com/fluxfm/sets/spreeblick.

In 2015, Tanja and Johnny started the idea of TINCON, a conference not unlike re:publica, but for teenagers only. Read more about it here: http://tincon.org.

Johnny is the father of two boys.

He is rarely bored.

His highly recommended book of short stories, "I live by the river!", is still available. Unlike this text here, it is written in German.

name: Helge Jürgens
bio:
Helge Jürgens ist Geschäftsführer der Standortentwicklung des Medienboard Berlin-Brandenburg. Der studierte Betriebswirt ist seit über 20 Jahren in leitenden Funktionen in der Film- und TV-Branche tätig. In den vergangenen Jahren war Helge Jürgens als Geschäftsführer bei der ARRI Film & TV tätig. Zu seinen Aufgaben gehörte u.a. die strategische Neuausrichtung des Unternehmens. Davor verantwortete er sechs Jahre, als Geschäftsführer der Berliner Union-Film, die Modernisierung des Traditionsunternehmens. Zuvor war er in unterschiedlichen Managementpositionen bei Endemol Deutschland tätig, u.a. als Prokurist, Gesamtherstellungsleiter sowie Leiter des Resources Management. Während seiner Laufbahn verantwortete er die Produktion von mehr als 200 Entertainment-, Film- und Serienformaten. In den letzten Jahren war Helge Jürgens auch als Unternehmensberater tätig und betreute renommierte Produktions- sowie Startup-Unternehmen.

_____

Helge Jürgens is managing director of media development at the Medienboard Berlin-Brandenburg. A business-administration graduate, he has held leadership roles in the film and TV industry for more than 20 years. Previously, Jürgens held the position of managing director at ARRI Film & TV. Among other functions, his duties included management of the company's strategic realignment. Earlier, he served for six years as managing director of Berlin Union-Film, with primary responsibility for the modernisation of that historic company. Prior to this time he held a number of management positions at Endemol Deutschland, serving variously as authorised representative, general production manager, and head of resources management. During his career, Jürgens has overseen the development of more than 200 entertainment, film, and serial productions. In recent years, he has also worked as a business consultant, advising high-profile production companies as well as start-ups.

name: Markus Beckedahl
bio:
Markus Beckedahl is one of the founders of re:publica. He is also the founder of netzpolitik.org, Germany's most known media outlet on digital rights issues.

He likes thinking about the internet and society.

name: Nils Markwardt
bio: Leitender Redakteur beim "Philosophie Magazin"

name: Stefan Niggemeier
bio: Freier Journalist, schreibt über Medien, vor allem auf Übermedien.de. Hat 2004 mit Christoph Schultheis das BILDblog gegründet und 2016 mit Boris Rosenkranz Übermedien. 2010-2012 Videoblogs vom ESC mit Lukas Heinser. Aktuell Medien-Kolumnen für FAS und Radio Eins, Podcast "Das kleine Fernsehballett" mit Sarah Kuttner auf Deezer.

name: danah boyd
bio: danah boyd is a Principal Researcher at Microsoft Research, the founder and president of Data & Society, and a Visiting Professor at New York University. Her research is focused on addressing social and cultural inequities by understanding the relationship between technology and society. Her most recent books - "It's Complicated: The Social Lives of Networked Teens" and "Participatory Culture in a Networked Age" - examine the intersection of everyday practices and social media. She is a 2011 Young Global Leader of the World Economic Forum, a member of the Council on Foreign Relations, a Director of both Crisis Text Line and Social Science Research Council, and a Trustee of the National Museum of the American Indian. She received a bachelor's degree in computer science from Brown University, a master's degree from the MIT Media Lab, and a Ph.D in Information from the University of California, Berkeley.

name: Samira El Ouassil
bio:
Kommunikationswissenschaftlerin

Kanzlerkandidatin

Politische Ghostwriterin

Schauspielerin

name: Claudia Simon
bio: kultur propagandistin und "The Queen of Typewriters": Claudia Simon macht seit Jahren kultur propaganda aka PR und Öffentlichkeitsarbeit, Kultur- und Projektmanagement, Print- und Webdesign und war 8 Jahre lang Vintage-Interior-Händlerin - darunter, na klar, Schreibmaschinen - in Neukölln. Sie benutzt die Schreibmaschinen nicht nur einfach so zum schreiben, sondern beschäftigt auch sich mit Geschichte, Technik, Wartung und Reparatur und verwendet sie in Kunstprojekten.

name: Nikola Aschoff
bio:
Nikola Aschoff works as Head of Product Management  - Extended Digital Services at Mercedes-Benz Car group. Main focus of her work are virtual assistants and cognitive services solutions.
Before she joined Daimler she worked 17 years at Microsoft and Hewlett-Packard and was driving digital transformation of  customers in different industries.

name: Maya Magnat
bio: Maya Magnat is a theater director and performance artist. She has a B.Ed. in theater directing and  M.F.A in Performance Research: Theory and Practice from the University of Tel Aviv and at the moment she is studying sex education at "Open Door" Voluntary association. Her works deal with creating intimacy through technology, sexuallity and technology, woman and technology and interactive art.
links: Interfacing Digital Theater - Lecture , Maya's website, Interfacing Intimacy talk at re:publica 2016, Interfacing - trailer

name: Theresa Züger
bio:
Theresa Züger ist Projektleiterin des Media Policy Lab, ein Projekt der Medienanstalt Berlin-Brandenburg. Sie arbeitet auch als Kuratorin und Moderatorin, z.B. für das internationale Festival transmediale 2016 und ist Wissenschaftliche Mitarbeiterin des Alexander von Humboldt Instituts für Internet und Gesellschaft. Sie studierte Medienwissenschaften, Philosophie und Germanistik an der Universität zu Köln und promovierte an der Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin in Medienwissenschaften. Ihre Doktorarbeit konzentriert sich auf digitale Formen des zivilen Ungehorsams sowie auf die Snowden-Leaks oder andere Whistleblowing-Phänomene. Sie ist im Beirat des Whistleblower Network Germany.

___________

Theresa Züger is the project lead of the media policy lab, a project by the media authority Berlin-Brandenburg. She also works as curator and moderator, e.g. for the international festival transmediale in 2016,  and is an associated researcher of the Alexander von Humboldt Institute for Internet and Society. She was trained at the University of Cologne in media studies, philosophy and German language and literature and holds a PhD from the Humboldt University of Berlin in media studies. Her PhD focusses on digital forms of civil disobedience, such as the Snowden leaks or other acts of whistleblowing and she is a board member of the Whistleblower Network Germany.

name: Jeannine Koch
bio:
I was born and raised in Berlin. I graduated from English, American and German studies. In 2008, I got a scholarship for a Master’s Degree in International Communications in Sydney, Australia. In 2010, I finished my Diploma in Media Studies at TU-Berlin. Shortly after, I hold the Head of Marketing & Communications position at a Berlin Shoe-Label. From 2012-2017 I was Marketing & Communications Director at Berlin´s first International Garden Exhibition (IGA Berlin 2017). Since 2018, I am more than happy to contribute to Europe´s biggest Digital Conference re:publica in Berlin as its Director. 

© Jan Florian Dietrich

name: Franz von Weizsäcker
bio: Franz von Weizsäcker is heading GIZ Blockchain Lab. He has been advising several governments on digital and innovation policies including Germany, Palestine and Saudi Arabia. Before that, he worked as management consultant in the telecommunications industry. His background is computer science from Berlin University of Technology.

name: Patricia Schlesinger
bio:
Am 14. Juli 1961 in Hannover geboren, volontierte Patricia Schlesinger beim Norddeutschen Rundfunk (NDR) und arbeitete als Reporterin, Redakteurin und Moderatorin für das ARD-Magazin "Panorama". Sie leitete das ARD-Studio Südostasien in Singapur und war USA-Korrespondentin in Washington. Nach ihrer Rückkehr übernahm sie die Leitung des Programmbereichs Kultur und Dokumentation beim NDR Fernsehen. Seit 2016 ist sie Intendantin des Rundfunk Berlin-Brandenburg. Von Patricia Schlesinger betreute Produktionen gewannen zahlreiche Auszeichnungen – darunter der Deutsche Filmpreis, Grimme- und Fernsehpreis, ein Emmy Award und ein Oscar. Patricia Schlesinger fördert junge Frauen im Mentorenprogramm des Journalistinnenbunds, sie engagiert sich im Kuratorium der Freien Universität Berlin, im Hochschulrat der HfS "Ernst Busch" sowie im Deutschen Komitee für UNICEF. Sie ist verheiratet und hat eine Tochter.

Foto: rbb/Thorsten Klapsch

__________

Patricia Schlesinger, born 14 July in Hanover, worked as a trainee at Norddeutscher Rundfunk (NDR) and as a reporter, editor and host for the ARD show “Panorama”. She headed the ARD Southeast Asia studio in Singapore and served as a US correspondent in Washington. Upon her return she took over as director for the cultural and documentary programming division at NDR television. Since 2016 she has been working as Director General at Rundfunk Berlin-Brandenburg broadcasting. Productions overseen by Patricia Schlesinger have won numerous awards – among them the German Film Award, Grimme and Television Awards, one Emmy and one Oscar. Within the mentoring programme of the German fe-male journalists’ association she promotes young female professionals, besides that she serves on the Freie Universität Berlin’s board of trustees, on the acad-emy council of the Ernst Busch Academy of Dramatic Arts and the German UNICEF national committee. She is married and has one daughter.
(Photo: rbb/Thorsten Klapsch)

name: Andrea-Regina Lang
bio: Seit 2001 Software Architect und Developer in der T-Systems.

name: Mark Graham
bio:
Mark Graham is the Professor of Internet Geography at the Oxford Internet Institute, a Faculty Fellow at the Alan Turing Institute, a Senior Research Fellow at Green Templeton College, and an Associate in the University of Oxford’s School of Geography and the Environment.

He leads a range of research projects spanning topics between digital labour, the gig economy, internet geographies, and ICTs and development. He has spent the last few years investigating the implications of new types of digital labour and online freelancing for workers in the Global South. This research is ongoing in his team’s research on outsourcing and microwork. At the moment, the tens of millions of workers who do digital work do so in a largely unregulated and socially disembedded way. This clearly benefits some workers, but we should also worry about a race to the bottom occurring as ever more people come online.
links: Mark Graham's twitter, Mark Graham's website

name: Sabria David
bio: Sabria David is co-founder of the Slow Media Institute. The Slow Media Institut (http://slow-media-institut.net/) is an interdisciplinary research and consulting centre for digital change and its impact on society, working environment and the world of media. Based on a mix of qualitative and quantitative methods, it focusses on concepts and models to constructively deal with disruptive changes and offers new perspectives for a resilient digital society. She has been on panels and talks like at the Council of Europe in Strasbourg, the Frankfurt Bookfair and other international conferences. She is with Benedikt Köhler and Jörg Blumtritt author of the "Declaration of Liquid Culture" and the “Slow Media Manifesto“ which had a global impact. It has been translated in several languages and is referred to, debated, taught and discussed in over 30 countries. She recently launched IDA, the Interaktionsmodell Digitaler Arbeitsschutz, a concept of workplace health that focusses on digital work. She studied linguistics, german literature and history of art and started to work both in research and advertising agencies. She now she works on the effects of digital technologies and collaborative thinking on society, work, politics, communication and media. In 2014 she has been elected to the board of Wikimedia Germany and relecteted in 2016 as Deputy Chair of the board. - - - - - - - - - - - - Sabria David ist Mitgründerin des Slow Media Instituts, das zu den Auswirkungen und Potentialen des digitalen Wandels auf Gesellschaft, Arbeit und Medien forscht und berät. Mit dem Soziologen Benedikt Köhler und dem Marktforscher Jörg Blumtritt verfasste sie 2010 das Slow Media Manifest, das in zahlreiche Sprachen übersetzt wurde, sowie 2012 die Declaration of Liquid Culture. Für den Bereich des betrieblichen Gesundheitsmanagement entwickelte sie das Interaktionsmodell Digitaler Arbeitsschutz aus medienwissenschaftlicher Perspektive (http://slow-media-institut.net/digitaler-arbeitschutz). Sie studierte Germanistik und Linguistik, forschte im Marbacher Literaturarchiv zu Textgenese. Seit November 2014 ist sie Mitglied des Präsidiums von Wikimedia Deutschland. Schwerpunkte: Digitaler Wandel, Mündlichkeit/Schriftlichkeit, Genese offener Werke, Kollaboration, Technikphilosophie, Arbeit der Zukunft, Digitaler Arbeitsschutz, mediale Nachhaltigkeit. - - - - - - - - - - - -

name: Offray Luna
bio: Offray Luna-Cárdenas is a long time hacktivist for knowledge and culture as common goods and digital technology as particular embodiment and enabler of them in several fields: Free Libre Open Source Software and Openness in Data, Science and Reproducible Research, Educational Resources and Government, knowledge management, among others. He has undergrad studies on Informatics-Mathematics, master studies on education and is a PhD(c) on design and creation. Is a founding member of the HackBo hackerspace in Bogotá (Colombia) and is working on reciprocal modification between communities and digital artifacts, by building and bridging critical code+data literacy and visualization community practices with moldable digital artifacts and pocket infrastructures. He works as a consultant, dataviz coder, teacher and researcher.

name: Anna Lena Schiller
bio:
The only re:publica I've missed was the first one in 2007. Since then I've always been doing something at the conference. Either live-drawing talks (check out my team's work at https://www.riesenspatz.de/), being on stage myself (presenting side projects like http://vizthink.de or https://www.instagram.com/datamadeofthings/) or, in recent years, supporting the program committee for the business and innovation track.

I'm a designer at heart with a soft spot for data. I like working for fun and freedom, money and meaning. 

  • visuals & design: @riesenspatz, @vizthink_DE,
  • digital & data:  @datathings, @datenschau
  • politics & sustainability: @savedemocracyHH

name: Spiros Pengas
bio: Spiros Pengas, Deputy Mayor for Tourism Development and International Relations and an elected local council member of Thessaloniki since 2011. He graduated from the German School of Thessaloniki and studied Political Science and International Relations at the Universities of Freiburg and Munich. He then worked in the office of United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) in Brussels. Returning to the city, he took over his family’s business, the Galerie Dora Penga, expanding it from a local business selling imported handmade carpets from the Middle East and Central Asia into a national company. In 2003, he founded the nonprofit “Eastern Paths” to promote cultural education activities, including guided trips to the countries of Asia. Spiros realized through various methods and tools the Mayor's vision for an extrovert and open to the world city. He is responsible for 'Cities Diplomacy' an awarded by Greek Hospitality Awards 2016, project and various spin offs and ideas (Thessaloniki Food Festival, Thessaloniki Mystery City, Study in Thessaloniki) that significantly contributed to the visibility of the city and helped to attract students, visitors and potential investors.

name: Marit Hansen
bio:
Marit Hansen ist seit 2015 die Landesbeauftragte für Datenschutz Schleswig-Holstein und leitet das Unabhängige Landeszentrum für Datenschutz (ULD). Davor war die Diplom-Informatikerin sieben Jahre lang stellvertretende Landesbeauftragte für Datenschutz Schleswig-Holstein. In ihrer Arbeit beschäftigen sich Frau Hansen und ihr Team mit den Herausforderungen für die Gesellschaft durch die zunehmende Digitalisierung, die interdisziplinär und in Kooperation mit Forschung und Wissenschaft betrachtet werden.

Seit 1995 arbeitet Frau Hansen zu Themen des Datenschutzes und der Informationssicherheit. Ihr Schwerpunkt liegt auf der grundrechtskonformen Gestaltung von Systemen, insbesondere durch Datenschutz "by Design" & "by Default".

name: Rahel Kraska
bio:
Singer I Mixed Media Artist

Rahel Kraska is an artist working in the intersection between music, technology and visual communication.

As a singer she performs in her One-Women-Show "Soundtrack fürs Leben" along with her music, selfcreated cartoons and videos.

She received her education in Jazz, Pop and Classical music. Being interested in artistic freedom and its connection to real life application, she studied the topic of Disruptive innovation and its consequences for Popular music within her Master Thesis.

name: Jurre Ongering
bio:
Jurre Ongering works at Waag as project manager for Creative Care Lab and several projects of other labs in the organisation..

Through previous work experience, Jurre is familiar with front-line and second-line care organizations, the care & nursing sector, and charities.

name: Henning Oberc
bio:
Berufsausbildung

03.2016 – heute           Wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter am Lehrstuhl für Produktionssysteme der Ruhr-Universität Bochum, Fachbereich „Produktionsmanagement“ - Lernfabrikkoordinator

05.2015 – 12.2015       Werkstudent und Masterand bei der Firma Metalltechnik Müller in Bochum, Thema: „Analyse und Optimierung der Produktionsprozesse eines Auftragsfertigers durch Um- und Neuplanung des Fertigungsstandortes“ 

08.2014 – 02.2015       Werkstudent bei der Bosch Rexroth AG in Witten (Bereich: Qualitätsmanagement)

02.2014 – 11.2015       Studentische Hilfskraft am Lehrstuhl für Produktionssysteme der Ruhr-Universität Bochum

03.2013 – 06.2013       Auslandssemester an der Drexel-University in Philadelphia

11.2011 – 03.2013       Studentische Hilfskraft am Lehrstuhl für Industrie- und Fahrzeugantriebstechnik der Ruhr-Universität (Großprojekt für neue Materialien in Windkraftanlagen)

10.2010 – 11.2015       Maschinenbaustudium an der Ruhr-Universität Bochum

09.2013 – 12.2013      Vierzehnwöchiges Praktikum in den Bereichen Projektierung, Instandhaltung und Forschung in der Härterei Reese in Bochum

name: Richard David Precht
bio: Richard David Precht, geboren 1964, ist Philosoph, Publizist und Autor und einer der profiliertesten Intellektuellen im deutschsprachigen Raum. Er ist Honorarprofessor für Philosophie an der Leuphana Universität Lüneburg sowie Honorarprofessor für Philosophie und Ästhetik an der Hochschule für Musik Hanns Eisler in Berlin. Seine Bücher wie "Wer bin ich – und wenn ja, wie viele?", "Liebe - ein unordentliches Gefühl" und "Die Kunst, kein Egoist zu sein" sind internationale Bestseller und wurden in insgesamt mehr als 40 Sprachen übersetzt. Zuletzt erschienen „Erkenne dich selbst", „Erkenne die Welt" und „Tiere denken". In seinem aktuellen Buch „Jäger, Hirten, Kritiker. Eine Utopie für die digitale Gesellschaft" (Goldmann Verlag) skizziert er das Bild einer wünschenswerten Zukunft im digitalen Zeitalter. Seit 2012 moderiert er die Philosophiesendung »Precht« im ZDF.

name: Geraldine de Bastion
bio: Geraldine de Bastion is a freelance consultant based in Berlin, Germany. She is an expert on information and communication technology and new media for development and advises organizations such as the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development and the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit on digital media and communication strategies. She also works with activists and bloggers around the world. Geraldine is founder of the consultancy Konnektiv GbR. She works as a free curator and moderator for re:publica and other international events. Geraldine has an honorary position as head of board at the German NGO Digitale Gesellschaft e.V. and is an active member of iceBauhaus e.V.. @Geralbine

name: Daniel Heltzel
bio: Managing Fab Lab Berlin, an innovation platform for students, startups and established companies to co-develop future (connected) hardware solutions.

name: Benjamin Immanuel Hoff
position: Chef der Staatskanzlei und Minister für Kultur, Bundes- und Europaangelegenheiten
bio:
Benjamin-Immanuel Hoff ist seit Dezember 2014 Minister für Kultur, Bundes- und Europaangelegenheiten und Chef der Staatskanzlei des Freistaats Thüringen. Davor war er unter anderem CEO bei der Strategieberatung MehrWertConsult, Rektor an der Business-School BEST-Sabel Hochschule Berlin sowie Staatssekretär für Gesundheit, Umwelt und Verbraucherschutz im Senat von Berlin (2006-2011). Seit 2010 ist er Honorarprofessor an der Alice-Salomon-Hochschule in Berlin und zudem Practitioner Fellow am Sussex Centre for Study of Corruption.

_____

Since December 2014, Benjamin-Immanuel Hoff has been the Minister for Culture, Federal and European Issues and head of the Minister-President’s Office of the German Free State of Thuringia. Prior to that, he was, for example, CEO at the strategic consulting firm MehrWertConsult, principal at the BEST-Sabel University of Berlin business school, as well as State Secretary for Health, the Environment and Consumer Protection in the Senate of Berlin (2006-2011). Since 2010, he has been an honorary professor at the Alice Salomon University in Berlin and additionally a Practitioner Fellow at the Sussex Centre for Study of Corruption.

name: Nadine Müller
bio: Studium der Psychologie an der FU Berlin. Wissenschaftliche Mitarbeiterin am Lehrstuhl für Innovationsforschung und nachhaltiges Ressourcenmanagement an der TU Chemnitz und bei der DGB-Index Gute Arbeit GmbH in Berlin. Promotion im Fach Wirtschafts- und Sozialwissenschaften an der Universität Kassel. Referentin im Bereich Innovation und Gute Arbeit beim Ver.di-Bundesvorstand in Berlin.
links: Agilität - Thema bei ver.di, Digitale Arbeit - Thema bei ver.di, Digitalisierung - Thema bei ver.di, ver.di-Digitalisierungskongresse

name: Amel Saidane
bio: Amel is co-founder of Seedstars Tunisia, a tech startup buiding and acceleration company, she is president of Tunisian Startups, the association giving a voice to Tunisian startups. She also acts as management consultant specialising in business strategy & digital transformation. Prior to that she has acted in different sales and client relationship management roles.  Working in Tunisia for some of the largest multinationals (Microsoft, Siemens, Nokia Siemens), Amel has an exhaustive knowledge of the Tunisian market and sales and marketing management practices. Amel is an engineer in electro-technics, qualified from the University of Hannover, Germany, she also holds a Master’s in Business in Digital economy from the University of Maryland.

name: Robin Wilson-Beattie
bio:
Robin Wilson-Beattie is a disability and sexuality health educator and writer, teaching the world to embrace and explore your sexuality,  regardless of ability. She is a member of the Association of American Sexual Educators, Counselors and Therapists (AASECT), the Women of Color Sexual Health Network (WOCSHN),  and a certified graduate and member of the San Francisco Sexuality Information Training (SFSI).  

Robin has been involved in sexuality education and awareness since high school. After acquiring a physical disability, she began in 2008 speaking on sexuality and disability topics and issues. She consults with individuals and organizations on issues of adaptive sexual support, and has had written articles and curriculum on this subject.  Robin is a nationally recognized self and systems disability advocate.  She is a deep-fried Southern girl, Sex Geek, comic book nerd, mid-century buff, and proud Mama of one amazing daughter. Follow Robin on Twitter @SexAbled, or like sexAbled on Facebook.
links: The Sex Educator Teaching BDSM to People With Disabilities, What you should know about birth control when you have a disability, Dating with a Disability Advice from an “inclusionista sexpert” on navigating d…

name: Chelsea Manning
bio:
Chelsea E. Manning is a technologist and network security expert whose actions have shown the power of individuals to change the world through bravery, conscience, and determination. She speaks on the social, technological and economic ramifications of Artificial Intelligence, and on the practical applications of machine learning. She is a vocal advocate for government transparency and queer and transgender rights as @xychelseaon Twitter and through her op-ed columns for The Guardian and The New York Times. 

History:

Chelsea E. Manning worked as an intelligence analyst for the U.S. Department of Defense, where she publicly disclosed classified documents that revealed human rights abuses and corruption connected to the U.S. wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. Upon being sentenced to 35 years for leaking government documents, an unprecedented amount of time for whistleblowers, she publicly identified as a trans woman and asserted her legal rights to medical therapy. After serving 7 years in military prison, President Barack Obama commuted her sentence to time served. She was released in 2017.

name: Michael Münz
bio: Michael Münz is Assistant of the Gustav Stresemann Institute’s Director. The GSI’s European Conference & Training Centre in Bonn is an independent, non-profit institution for political education above party lines. As an institution for political education, the GSI organises conferences, symposia, congresses, workshops and seminars on all relevant political issues. The key focus here is on European policy and security policy, as well as on international collaboration. Specifically European themes are at the heart of the GSI’s work. As the Director’s Assistant Michael Münz cultivates the GSI’s network of contacts, adding new partners and developing new projects such as publications, discussion panels and conferences. The trained teacher and journalist is also involved in Company Development projects. Previously, he worked for Deutsche Welle, Germany’s international broadcaster. He joined DW as Internal Communications Manager and later joined the Director General’s office. Münz then coordinated DW’s cooperations with strategic partners before working as Deputy Head of the Social Media News Department. Michael Münz has a Master of Education from Osnabrück University and has worked as Assistant Teacher in London. He published a book on Social Media in 2010, runs several blogs and has worked as freelancer for newspapers and magazines. Münz is also co-founder and organizer of the Socialbar Bonn, a regular event to discuss the possibilities of social media for the civil society. Running in its eighth year, participants come from NPOs, Activists, Politicians, Social Entrepreneurs and Volunteers.

name: Pantelis Angelidis
bio: Dr. Pantelis Angelidis is currently the President of the Thessaloniki Innovation Zone. A Telecommunications Engineering by education, he has worked as a technology expert in the areas of telemedicine and Digital Health for the past 20 years. He is the founder of VIDAVO, an innovative Digital Health SME in Greece. He is actively publishing research articles and textbooks. He has patented four telemedicine devices.  Dr. Angelidis was a visiting professor at MIT Media Lab in 2009-10 and again in 2015-16. He is Prof. on eHealth at UOWM and a visiting lecturer at UB Medical School. He is a Marshall Memorial fellow and an alumni of the Bodosaki foundation. He is active in turning research results into profitable businesses focusing on technologies for preventive health and active ageing.

name: Andrew Tobin
bio:
I am working to change the way the global identity ecosystem and the personal information economy operates. The triggers for that change, and the opportunities that are emerging, are creating rapid growth in "IDTech" innovation which will dwarf what's happening in Fintech. 

I predict a post-silo world, where big, inefficient and vulnerable silos of personal data are replaced by "just-in-time" identity, finally catching up with the digital age. With this change the platform of one will emerge, where every individual has their own service matching platform based on trusted and secure peer interactions.

Specialities: digital identity, distributed ledger technology, blockchain, mobile fintech, NFC, digital ID, retail payments, m-Commerce, infrastructure virtualisation, app development, real-time transaction processing.

name: Matthias Strobel
bio: Matthias Strobel is a serial entrepreneur and innovator who bridges the worlds of music and technology. His first serious contact with music happened already in his early childhood days when he started to take piano lessons at the age of five. With eight years, he joined the Regensburger Domspatzen, the worl’s most famous boys choir. From then on music stayed as important part of his life.
