Charlie Winter is a Senior Research Fellow at the International Centre for the Study of Radicalisation at King's College London. He studies terrorism and insurgency, with a focus on online and offline strategic communication. He is pursuing a PhD in War Studies which examines how propaganda articulates meaning and, more broadly, exploring how militant groups cultivate creative approaches to governance and war. Alongside his work at ICSR, he is an Associate Fellow at the International Centre for Counter-Terrorism in the Hague.

Winter’s work has been published by, among others, Critical Studies in Media Communication, Studies in Conflict and Terrorism, Philosophia, the CTC Sentinel, The Atlantic, War On The Rocks, Jihadology and the BBC. He holds an undergraduate degree in Arabic from the University of Edinburgh and an MA in Middle East and Mediterranean Studies from King’s College London.

name: Christian Friedrich
bio:
Christian works as Education and Science Advisor at Wikimedia Germany. He blogs eratically in English and German at christianfriedrich.org. Together with Markus Deimann, he hosts a German-speaking podcast on Open Education and digital technologies in education, The "Feierabendbier Open Education".

Christian ist Referent für Bildung und Wissenschaft bei Wikimedia Deutschland. Er bloggt unregelmäßig unter christianfriedrich.org und veröffentlicht gemeinsam mit Markus Deimann seit Sommer 2016 das “Feierabendbier Open Education” – einen Podcast, der sich Fragen zur Öffnung von Bildung, insbesondere mit einem Blick auf digitale Technologie, widmet.
links: Christian's website and blog , Podcast Feierabendbier Open Education, Towards Openness, Christian on twitter

name: Adriana Groh
bio: Adriana Groh studied political science, sociology, and public policy and governance in Frankfurt am Main and Maastricht. In her studies, she took a particular interest in questions such as: How does our society work and how does it work even better? What makes good democratic processes? And above all, how can we turn this into reality with the help of digital tools? After writing her thesis on questions of political participation, Adriana understood that political communication and participation have to get easier, faster, more accessible - and more digital. An idea was born and since 2016 she has applied her academic knowledge to the development of the project "wepublic". It has since then developed from an idea into a dynamic startup, with the launch of the app "+me" as a pilot project for the German general election in 2017. Currently, Adriana is focused on reaching a new objective for wepublic: creating better digital tools for citizens and politicians to communicate and cooperate in-between elections.

name: Daniel Heltzel
bio: Managing Fab Lab Berlin, an innovation platform for students, startups and established companies to co-develop future (connected) hardware solutions.

name: Maya Indira Ganesh
bio: Maya has been working at the intersection of new media, digital technologies, gender, visual advocacy and activism and human rights as a researcher, writer, and information-activist. She spent the past eight years with Tactical Technology Collective in Bangalore and Berlin where she was the Director of Applied Research. She is a doctoral candidate at Leuphana University in Germany, investigating machine learning, ethics and accountability. She has presented at technology, activism, art and academic events like Eyeo Festival, re:publica, Transmediale, Chaos Communication Congress,  Theorizing The Web, Netzpolitik, and at the Canadian Centre for Architecture, among others.

name: Kati Krause
bio: Kati Krause is an editor at Anxy magazine and Berlin correspondent for Monocle. She has created and run several magazines and also works as an editorial consultant for media and companies.

name: Lejla Sadiku
organization: UNDP in Europe and Central Asia
bio: I'm Lejla Sadiku and I work on applying innovations in the intersection of participation, governance and new technologies at United Nations Development Programme’s Hub for Europe and Central Asia. I spend my time at UNDP experimenting with new approaches, new data and new technologies for solving development challenges, having smarter and more open governance, and a more dynamic civic space.

name: Julian Ringhof
bio: Julian Ringhof is a project manager at Fab Lab Berlin, a hub for rapid prototyping and co-creation. There he is also the coordinator of the ecoMaker project, which aims at facilitating awareness in sustainable design.

name: Abdelkarim *
bio:
Abdelkarim wurde 1981 als Sohn marokkanischer Einwanderer in Bielefeld geboren. Nach dem Besuch der Hauptschule und dem Abitur studierte er Jura an der Universität Bochum. Seit 2010 arbeitet Abdelkarim hauptberuflich als Comedian und wurde mit renommierten Kabarettpreisen ausgezeichnet: Jurypreis des großen Kleinkunstfestivals der Wühlmäuse 2011, Gewinner des Jahresfinals 2010 zum NDR Comedy Contest, Hölzerner Stuttgarter Besen 2012 beim SWR Kabarettfestival. 2015 wurde ihm der Bayerische Kabarettpreis in der Kategorie Senkrechtstarter verliehen. 2018 erhielt Abdelkarims Sendung zur Bundestagswahl, „Endlich Klartext!“, in dem er Spitzenpolitiker mit realen
Bürgerproblemen konfrontierte, in der Kategorie „Beste Information“ den Deutschen Fernsehpreis. Abdelkarim ist Stammgast in fast allen gängigen Kabarett- und Comedy-Formaten im TV: „heute show“ und „Die Anstalt“ / ZDF, Nuhr im Ersten, Pufpaffs Happy Hour / 3sat / SWR Spätschicht, ehemals TV Total / Prosieben, u.v.m.. 2013 bis 2016 lief seine erste eigene Fernsehreihe, die er moderierte, „StandUpMigranten“, im ARD-Kanal EinsPlus, die bis heute noch auf vielen Kanälen als Wiederholungen laufen. Mit seinem ersten Soloprogramm „Zwischen Ghetto und Germanen“, das im Januar 2014 auch als CD erschien, war er bis Ende 2016 auf Deutschland-Tournee. 2017 startete sein 2. Soloprogramm „Staatsfreund Nr. 1“.

www.abdelkarim.tv

_____

Abdelkarim  was born in Bielefeld in 1981, as son of Moroccan immigrants. After attending Hauptschule general school and passing the Abitur general qualification for university entrance he studied law at the University of Bochum. Since 2010, Abdelkarim has worked full-time as a comedian and has received well-known cabaret prizes: Jury Prize of the “Großes Kleinkunstfestival” of the Wühlmäuse cabaret 2011, winner of the annual finale 2010 for the NDR Comedy Contest, Hölzerner Stuttgarter Besen 2012 at the SWR Kabarettfestival. In 2015, he was awarded the Bavarian Cabaret Prize in the “Instant Success” category. In 2018, Abdelkarim’s broadcast “Endlich Klartext!” on the German Bundestag parliamentary elections, in which he confronted top politicians with real problems of citizens, received the German Television Award in the category “Best Information”. Abdelkarim is a regular on almost all common popular cabaret and comedy formats on TV: “heute show” and “Die Anstalt” / ZDF, Nuhr im Ersten, Pufpaffs Happy Hour / 3sat / SWR Spätschicht, formerly TV Total / Prosieben, and many more. From 2013 to 2016, his first own TV series that he moderated, “StandUpMigranten”, was broadcast on the ARD channel EinsPlus and is, to date, still being broadcast on many channels as reruns. With his first solo programme, “Between Ghetto and Teutons”, which, in January 2014, also was released as a CD, he was on tour across Germany until the end of 2016. In 2017, he started his 2nd solo programme, “Public Friend No. 1”.

name: Marios Mouratidis
position: YALLAH Project Coordinator & comeIN@Palestine Club Supervisor
bio:
Student of M. Sc. Human Computer Interaction, University of Siegen.

Freelance Media Designer.

Maker.

name: Andrew Hudson
organization: Imaginary College at the ASU Center for Science and the Imagination
bio: Writer of speculative fiction. Thinker on climate. Solarpunk. Anticapitalist organizer.

name: Tanja Braun
bio: Techniktagebuch

name: Nicole Celikkesen
bio:
Nicole has been working in the field of media relations and communication consulting since 1999. At the beginning, her focus was mainly on the ITC sector. Meanwhile she has extensive and long-term experience in the technology and digital industries.

In addition to the classical instruments of PR and media, Nicole is also specialized in new forms of communication in the digital environment and crisis communication.

After eight years in corporate communications, she switched to a communications agency and advised companies, institutions and organizations.

Since 2016 she has been working full-time as Head of Partner Management at republica GmbH.

Topics: #Digitization #Media #SciFi#Communication #NetPolitics#DigitalSociety #Technology

name: Eva Schulz
bio:
Eva Schulz (27) ist Reporterin und Moderatorin. Sie experimentiert besonders gern mit Social Media und Apps und probiert aus, wie man auf Twitter, Snapchat und co. Geschichten erzählen und Wissen vermitteln kann. Eva ist die Frontfrau von „Deutschland3000“ (funk / rbb), einem Facebook-Format, das politische Themen aus der Perspektive von Millenials betrachtet. Zuvor hat sie für funk bereits den Snapchat-Kanal „Hochkant“ mit konzipiert, auf dem tagesaktuelle Nachrichten für junge User aufbereitet werden. Schulz schrieb Kolumnen für Jetzt.de und Zeit Campus, entwickelte die erste deutsche Ausgabe von Wired mit und war für das junge TV-Magazin „Klub Konkret“ (EinsPlus / ARD) als Reporterin unterwegs. Danach verbrachte sie ein halbes Jahr als Trialogue of Cultures Fellow in Jerusalem und Tel Aviv.

Sie hat Kommunikation, Kultur und Wirtschaft an der Zeppelin Universität studiert und ihre Abschlussarbeit über Innovationsverhinderung im öffentlich-rechtlichen Fernsehen geschrieben (tl;dr: It’s a mess.). Nach einem Forschungsaufenthalt als Media Fellow an der Duke University in Durham, North Carolina, studierte sie ein Masterprogramm in Urban Studies und reiste dafür zwei Semester lang durch Europa. Kürzlich wurde sie vom Medium Magazin als Unterhaltungsjournalistin des Jahres 2017 ausgezeichnet.

_____

Eva Schulz (27) is a reporter and host. She loves to experiment with social media and apps and tries her hand at  telling stories and imparting knowledge via Twitter, Snapchat and others. Eva is the frontwoman at “Deutschland3000” (funk / rbb), a Facebook format contemplating political topics from the perspective of millenials. Previously, she devised the concept for funk’s Snapchat channel “Hochkant” (“Portrait”), which prepares daily news for young users. Schulz has written columns for Jetzt.de and Zeit Campus, developed the first German edition of Wired and was on the road as a reporter for the young TV magazine “Klub Konkret” (EinsPlus / ARD). After that, she spent half a year in Jerusalem and Tel Aviv as a Trialogue of Cultures Fellow.

She studied communication, culture and economics at Zeppelin Universität and wrote her thesis on the inhibition of innovation in public state broadcasting (tl;dr: It’s a mess.). After a Media Fellow research residence at Duke University in Durham, North Carolina, she pursued a master's course in urban studies, during the course of which she travelled across Europe for two semesters. Recently, she was given the award for entertainment journalist of the year 2017 by Medium Magazin.

name: Will Senyo
bio:
William is Co-Founder & CEO of Impact Hub Accra with a mission to build Osu Ako Adjei area as the city’s innovation district and the nerve center for Accra’s entrepreneurs & bold thinkers. His work is at the nexus of Talent, Tech & Capital for social impact. He has led Impact Hub Accra’s growth to become Accra’s premier startup hotspot with a diverse community of 250+ members and over 1700sqm of progressively green workspaces under management. 

Working with a grassroots movement committed to “DIY Urbanism”, William and his team are focused on transforming spaces all across Osu Ako Adjei into activated living and work spaces where different local and global ecosystem players converge to engage Ghana’s vibrant young entrepreneurs.He has led teams to raise capital from a mix of investors and donors, including the Rockefeller Foundation, Tony Elumelu Foundation, the Danish Government and the US Government's Broadcasting Board of Governors.  

William has worked on a number of social innovation initiatives across Africa and has managed the implementation of startup support projects for partners such as Facebook, Ashoka, MasterCard Foundation, Siemens Foundation, USAID, and the British Council.He was one of 100 global innovators selected to work with IDEO and British Airways on Ungrounded, the first social innovation lab in the sky (From San Francisco to London). He is co-convener of the Social Enterprise Ghana, working to build a robust social enterprise ecosystem.

William is a World Economic Forum Global Shaper and serves on the taskforce drafting the first Social Enterprise Policy for the Government of Ghana.
links: Interview with Dutch Prime Minister, Mark Rutte, LinkedIn, About Us-Impact Hub Accra, Interview @ Harvard Social Enterprise Conference

name: Anett Gläsel-Maslov
bio:
Anett Gläsel-Maslov wurde vor langer Zeit mit dem Virus Augmented Reality infiziert. Gemeinsam mit dem Münchner Pionier für AR, Metaio, missionierte sie als PR-Managerin für die Technologie. Bis zu dem Tag, an dem Pokémon Go kam und es kaum mehr Aufklärung bedurfte. Plötzlich wussten nicht nur Kinder und Jugendliche, was Augmented Reality ausmacht und für die Zukunft bedeuten könnte. Die Faszination um die Technologie hält bis heute an. Seit 2016 organisiert Anett als selbständige Unternehmerin Konferenzen und kommuniziert für Unternehmen zu den Themen Augmented und Virtual Reality, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning und Big Data. Mehr Informationen unter: www.ideentraeger-pr.de. 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Anett Gläsel-Maslov was infected quite a while ago, the virus is called augmented reality. She became PR-Manager at Metaio, doing missionary work for the AR technology together with the company. This was only necessary until Pokémon Go came up, from that moment on hardly any education was needed anymore. The technology’s use and potential suddenly became evident for everyone, not just the youth, and people are still fascinated by it these days. Since 2016 Anett has been operating as a freelancing entrepreneur, organising conferences and providing communication services for several companies about augmented and virtual reality, artifcial intelligence, machine learning and big data. More information at www.ideentraeger-pr.de.

name: Martin Fischer
bio: Geboren in Thüringen, lebe im Norden und im Süden und sendet ins Internet – aktuell via "Staatsbürgerkunde", einem Podcastprojekt über das Leben in der DDR.

name: Joseph Cox
bio: Joseph is a journalist covering cybersecurity, the digital underground, and the surveillance industry.

name: Julian Jaursch
bio:
Julian Jaursch ist politischer Referent im Digitale Gesellschaft e.V. und koordiniert dort "Deine Daten. Deine Rechte.", das Informationsportal für Verbraucher*innen zu den neuen EU-Datenschutzregeln (gefördert vom Bundesministerium der Justiz und für Verbraucherschutz). Er bringt Erfahrung aus journalistischen Redaktionen und der Politikberatung ein und forschte zur EU und den transatlantischen Beziehungen.

 

Julian Jaursch is a political advisor at the NGO Digitale Gesellschaft e.V. in Berlin, where he coordinates "Your Data. Your Rights.", the web portal for consumers on the new EU data protection rules (supported by the Federal Ministry of Justice and Consumer Protection). He uses his experiences from editorial offices and political consulting and he has conducted research on EU topics and transatlantic relations.
links: Deine Daten. Deine Rechte. Das Informationsportal für Verbraucher*innen zum neu…

name: Feranak Amidi
bio:
Feranak Amidi is a London based journalist, she is  the women’s affairs journalist for the Near East Region of the BBC World Service, focusing on women’s issues in countries such as Iran, Afghanistan and Uzbekistan. Feranak comes from a TV background but now focuses mainly on digital platforms; producing material for the language services of the BBC World Service with women in mind and to increase female audience engagement on social media platforms of the BBC language services.

Feranak uses social media as her main news gathering tool to reach out to women in Iran, Afghanistan and other countries in the region. Her focus right now is to encourage women of the region to tell their stories through blogs and video blogs; in a region where women are mostly silenced Feranak believes that social media can give them a platform to be heard and to share common experiences creating a female narrative of life which is not much present on social media of countries in this region.
links: #MosqueMeToo, Modern Women in Mongolia, Disabled Women and Sexual needs in Iran, Shame, Virginity and Smear Tests in Iran

name: Arikia Millikan
bio: Arikia Millikan is a journalist and online media entrepreneur from New York City. She moved to Berlin in July of 2017 and worked as editorial lead at Tactical Tech before founding CTRL+X, a research and development agency exploring alternative technological platforms and business models for online media. In 2013 she founded LadyBits, a publishing collective for tech-savvy women. Prior to that she was an editor at WIRED and lead researcher for Nate Silver during production of the #1 best-selling book, The Signal and the Noise. In her spare time she writes sci-fi and trains parrots.

name: Walter Palmetshofer
bio: Walter Palmetshofer was sysadmin at the Ars Electronica Center, worked for 5 years as the CTO of The Thing / thing.net and various art- & netactivismprojects in NYC, collected various startup experience, into open data since 2010, studied economics and is currently at the Open Knowledge Foundation.

name: Frauke Pohl
bio: Frauke Pohl hat sich lange ehrenamtlich in der Jugendleiterausbildung engagiert und im Amerikanistik-Studium festgestellt, dass die Kombination ihrer Nebenfächer Medienwissenschaft und Pädagogik den gewünschten Schwerpunkt für ihre berufliche Zukunft darstellt. Das Thema Neues Lernen mit Medien hat sie zunächst über Einsätze im Veranstaltungsmanagement von Bildungskongressen weiterverfolgt. Aktuell ist Frauke Pohl beim Institut für Berufliche Bildung, einem Weiterbildungsanbieter, tätig: Seit 2011 koordiniert sie virtuelle Umschulungen, seit mehr als vier Jahren auch in leitender Funktion. Roter Faden ist dabei die Frage "Wie können wir Menschen mit digitaler Bildung auf die Anforderungen der Arbeitswelt vorbereiten?"

name: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
bio: I'm a staff writer at Motherboard, where I cover hacking, information security, and digital rights.

name: Michael Schulte
organization: Klexikon - die erste deutschsprachige Wikipedia-Alternative für Kinder
bio: Journalist. Gründer und Projektleiter des Online-Lexikons @Klexikon und der Hörplattform @Ohrka. Beides kostenlose Angebote für Kinder. Das eine als Alternative zur Wikipedia und das andere als Jederzeit-Hörangebot im Netz. Foto: CC BY SA 4.0 Ziko van Dijk.

name: Daniela Platsch
bio: Daniela Platsch ist Regionalökonomin und arbeitet insbesondere zu den Themen Globalisierung, Strukturwandel und Organisationskultur. Sie ist politische Geschäftsführerin von Der Wandel.

name: Guido Brombach
bio: Guido Brombach arbeitet seit 2000 im Bereich Digitale Kommunikation, Lernen und Medien des DGB Bildungswerks. Er konzipiert und führt in diesem Bereich Seminare im Rahmen der politischen Bildung durch. Seit seinem Pädagogik-Studium beschäftigt er sich damit, wie Menschen lernen. In diesem Zusammenhang forscht er über den (bisher) schmalen Pfad an dem sich die analoge und die digitale Welt treffen und welche Möglichkeiten sich daraus für die Bildungspraxis ergeben.

name: Fernanda Conti
bio: Fernanda Conti ist Head of Global Marketing Communication bei der STABILO International GmbH - einem der führenden Schreibgerätehersteller in Europa. In dieser Position verantwortet die gebürtige Italienerin die Bereiche Brand Management, Social Media und Content Marketing auf globaler Ebene. Nach mehreren Stationen in der digitalen Welt, u.a. für die Scout24 Gruppe und Otto Group, unterstützt die 35-Jährige jetzt die traditionsreiche Marke bei der Gestaltung des digitalen Wandels.

name: Philipp Thurmann
bio: Philipp Thurmann ist Gesellschafter und Geschäftsführer der buddybrand GmbH. Der 35-Jährige verantwortet dort die Bereiche Planning und Strategie. Buddybrand ist eine führende deutsche Kreativ- und Social Media Agentur und begleitet internationale Markenunternehmen wie Disney, Microsoft oder Storck (merci, Toffifee) durch den digitalen Wandel.

name: Valerie Sternberg
bio: Valerie Sternberg ist Deutschland Präsidentin der pan-europäischen Bewegung Volt Europa, deren Ziel es ist bei den Wahlen im Mai 2019 als erste wirklich pan-europäische Partei in das Europäische Parlament einzuziehen. Sie studierte Volkswirtschaft und European Studies in Münster, Siena und Bath und arbeitet momentan als politische Kommunikationsberaterin in Berlin.

name: Paul Loeper
bio: Paul is lead field community organizer at Volt Europa a movement which mobilizeses for the creation of the first true pan-European parties for the European elections in May 2019. He studied business administration and media security studies in Berlin and Glasgow and has worked both in the private as well as in the public sector. Reality built thorugh attention is currently his favorite political topic

name: Michael Schulte
organization: Klexikon - die erste deutschsprachige Wikipedia-Alternative für Kinder
bio: Journalist. Gründer und Projektleiter des Online-Lexikons @Klexikon und der Hörplattform @Ohrka. Beides kostenlose Angebote für Kinder. Das eine als Alternative zur Wikipedia und das andere als Jederzeit-Hörangebot im Netz. Foto: CC BY SA 4.0 Ziko van Dijk.

name: Dennis Kogel
bio: Dennis Kogel is a reporter, host and editor covering games and web culture. He was published in various magazines and websites, such as Spiegel Online, GameStar and Sueddeutsche Zeitung, as well as on German public radio with Radio Fritz and others. He is currently working as a podcast host and senior editor at Motherboard, the science and tech magazine by VICE.

name: Silja Vöneky
position: Director, Prof. IntLaw & Ethics of Law, Freiburg
bio:
Prof. Dr. Silja Voeneky is the (Co-)Director of the Institute for Public Law and the Professor of Public International Law, Comparative Law and Ethics of Law. She joined the University of Freiburg in 2010 and is an associated member of the Institute for Philosophy of Law. In 2015-2016, she was a Visiting Fellow at Harvard Law School and will be a Fellow at the 2018-2019 Freiburg FRIAS Research Group "Emerging ethical, legal, philosophical and social aspects of the interaction between humans and autonomous intelligent systems". Her areas of focus include Security Law and Humanitarian Law, International Environmental Law, the Law of the Sea, Human Rights Law, the interdependence of Ethics and Law, and questions on Legitimacy, Democracy, Biomedicine, and the governance of catastrophic risks.

Voeneky previously served as the Director of the Heidelberg Max Planck Research Group (“Democratic Legitimacy of Ethical Decisions"). From 2012-2016, she was a member of the German Ethics Council, whose members are appointed by the Federal Government, and was the head of the Council’s Working Group on Biosecurity. Currently, she is, inter alia, a member of the international law expert group of the German Federal Foreign Office (Völkerrechtswissenschaftlicher Beirat), a member of the Standing Committee on Science and Ethics of the Leopoldina, National Academy of Sciences, and a member of the Ethics Council of the Max Planck Society (since 2016). Previously, she was member of the Board of Directors of the Network for Civil Security Law in Europe (KORSE). Born in Germany, Voeneky studied Law and Philosophy of Law at the Universities of Freiburg, Bonn, Heidelberg, and Edinburgh. She began her career at the Max Planck Institute for Public International Law in Heidelberg

name: Geraldine de Bastion
bio: Geraldine de Bastion is a freelance consultant based in Berlin, Germany. She is an expert on information and communication technology and new media for development and advises organizations such as the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development and the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit on digital media and communication strategies. She also works with activists and bloggers around the world. Geraldine is founder of the consultancy Konnektiv GbR. She works as a free curator and moderator for re:publica and other international events. Geraldine has an honorary position as head of board at the German NGO Digitale Gesellschaft e.V. and is an active member of iceBauhaus e.V.. @Geralbine

name: Christoph Boecken
bio: Ist in Buenos Aires geboren, sagt aber, dass das nur als Opener für ein Gespräch taugt, weil er sonst keine Erinnerungen daran hat. Lebt und arbeitet in Berlin als Softwareentwickler beim TINCON e.V. und ist in seiner Freizeit die meiste Zeit über mit einer Kamera um den Hals anzutreffen. Hat das Internet schon durchgelesen.

name: Ricardo Ferrer Rivero
bio: Ric wurde in Venezuela geboren, ging zeitweise in den USA zur Schule und zog nach seinem Schulabschluss nach Deutschland. Hier hat er in den letzten 12 Jahren gelebt und gearbeitet. Als Mitgründer vom Hafven (Coworking und Maker Space), VRTX Labs (Augmented Reality), PEY (Bitcoin & Blockchain) und 533 AG (Investment) ist Ric in vielfältige Projekte eingebunden. Privat liebt er das Kochen und genießt die Zeit mit seiner Familie und seinen Freunden. Ric ist ein Befürworter des sogenannten Transhumanismus und möchte durch sein Wirken die Dezentralisierung vorantreiben. Mit Hilfe neuer Technologien möchte Ric die Zukunft der Menschheit mitgestalten, voranbringen und verbessern.
links: Presse Artikel, 533 AG (Investment Gesellschaft), Hafven - Coworking and Makerspace, Mana - Meal Replacement, Effortless Food

name: Anne Marie C. Befoune
bio: Befoune is a Cameroonian blogger and translator living in Senegal. She is passionate with citizen participation and civic action, what led to the creation of Elle Citoyenne in 2015, a personal blog that became a collaborative media with more than 40 contributors across Africa.

name: Daniel Recktenwald
bio: Daniel Recktenwald is a PhD candidate in the Department of English at the Hong Kong Polytechnic University. He received his M.A. in English and German Linguistics from Saarland University under the supervision of Prof. Neal Norrick. The thesis was on Interactional Practices in Let’s Play Videos. His scurrent research interests are traditionally text-based forms of computer-mediated communication as well as the form and function of discourse in online live streaming of video games on Twitch and Let’s Play videos on YouTube.

name: Alexandra Wolf
bio: Art thoerist, internet enthusiast, trash POP lover ... and: Programme Director #rp17 "Love out Loud"  & #rp18 "POP"

name: Jonas von Malottki
bio: Jonas holds a diploma in Computer Science and Japanese Studies from the University of Bonn. Focus topics where Metadata and Data Quality as well as Neural Networks. Within Daimler he previously was in architect roles and various leadership positions. He has a keen interest in new technologies and the Open Source movement. In his current role he is shaping the Blockchain and DLT activities from the technology perspective within Daimler. As a member of the governing board of Hyperledger he is also representing that role internationally.

name: Frauke Pohl
bio: Frauke Pohl hat sich lange ehrenamtlich in der Jugendleiterausbildung engagiert und im Amerikanistik-Studium festgestellt, dass die Kombination ihrer Nebenfächer Medienwissenschaft und Pädagogik den gewünschten Schwerpunkt für ihre berufliche Zukunft darstellt. Das Thema Neues Lernen mit Medien hat sie zunächst über Einsätze im Veranstaltungsmanagement von Bildungskongressen weiterverfolgt. Aktuell ist Frauke Pohl beim Institut für Berufliche Bildung, einem Weiterbildungsanbieter, tätig: Seit 2011 koordiniert sie virtuelle Umschulungen, seit mehr als vier Jahren auch in leitender Funktion. Roter Faden ist dabei die Frage "Wie können wir Menschen mit digitaler Bildung auf die Anforderungen der Arbeitswelt vorbereiten?"

name: Rebecca Raschun
bio:
Ich bin Becci. Eine Wienerin, die es nach Berlin verschlagen hat. 

Ich startete 2012 meinen Twitch Kanal "Beccisplayground" und bin seitdem "just a girl playing games". Das ermöglichte mir viele interessante Menschen kennen zu lernen und an tollen Projekten mit zu wirken. Unter anderem hatte ich eine eigene Morningshow bei ProsiebenGames, wo wir über die neusten Games gesprochen haben und regelmäßig spannende Gäste geladen. Auf der gamescom durfte ich die Twitch Bühne hosten und als Laudatorin zwei Kategorien des gamescom Awards vergeben. 

Videospiele waren immer ein großer Bestandteil in meinem Leben und ich wollte auf jeden Fall in diesem Bereich etwas voranbringen. Deswegen starte ich 2013 mit meinem Studium in Medien- und Eventmanagement welches ich 2017 erfolgreich abgeschlossen habe. 

Derzeit streame ich 6x die Woche auf meinem Twitch Kanal, kooperiere mit Red Bull Austria und moderiere/hoste Bühnen auf diversen Veranstaltungen.

name: Philipp Kellmeyer
bio: Dr Kellmeyer is a neurologist at the University Medical Center Freiburg, Germany and works as a clinical neuroscientist on brain-computer interfacing to restore communication in severely paralyzed neurological patients. He is also a scientific member of the Cluster of Excellence ("Exzellenzcluster") BrainLinks-BrainTools, an interdisciplinary research consortium on neurotechnological research at the University of Freiburg. In his neuroethical work he is particularly interested in the ethical challenges of emerging neurotechnologies, applications of machine learning, big data and AI in clinical neuroscience, as well as ethics issues in disorders of consciousness and neurodegenerative diseases. He is a member of the Emerging Issues Task Force of the International Neuroethics Society and the Advisory Committee of the Neuroethics Network. He is currently a Senior Fellow (2018-19) at the Freiburg Institute for Advanced Studies (FRIAS) Research Group "Responsible AI: Normative aspects of the interaction of humans and intelligent systems".
links: Lab webpage, Twitter, Insitute for Biomedical Ethics, Zurich, Session at re:publica 18: The end for freedom of thought? On the commercial use…

name: Uri Aviv
bio: Uri Aviv is a cultural entrepreneur, artistic consultant, project manager and Science fiction evangelist. Aviv is the founder and general director of the Utopia Association and its namesake festival, the Tel-Aviv International festival of science fiction and fantastic film, and its program of Science, Imagination and Future Visions events. Outside of Utopia, Aviv is Promethean, providing artistic direction and consultancy, content editing and production to projects, events and organizations intertwining science, culture, technology, philosophy, futurism and geek culture in general.

name: Felix Schwenzel
bio: Felix Schwenzel schreibt gerne ins Internet.

name: Martin Fischer
bio: Geboren in Thüringen, lebe im Norden und im Süden und sendet ins Internet – aktuell via "Staatsbürgerkunde", einem Podcastprojekt über das Leben in der DDR.

name: Cem Ergün-Müller
bio:
Cem Ergün-Müller is Head of Digital Open Space at Deutsche Telekom AG. As an innovation manager his main target is to extend the company's innovation network across all domains. 
For some years now, digital transformation has been at the core of its activities in all its facets. One focus is the development of innovation through co-innovation and co-creation across enterprise boundaries. But still the customer should always be the focus of all activities.

He is also the founder of Startupnight (Lange Nacht der Startups).  Prior activities: Head of Communication and member of the management team of T-Labs,  Managing Director Connected Living, et al. Born in Milano, Italia, he majored in Marketing and Communication and enhanced his capabilities with a Master in Enterprise Information Management at the Henley Management School of the University of Reading in England. He is married with two children.

name: Aisha Dabo
bio:
I am an active PanAfrican citizen. An "accidental" Afropolitan ?.

I am passionate about human rights in general, women's and children's rights, gender equality and equity, basic freedoms (speech, opinion, assembly, association, religion -access to information and right to know), good governance, participatory democracy, web activism, youth issues, culture and arts.

name: Mushon Zer-Aviv
bio: Mushon Zer-Aviv is a designer, an educator and a media activist based in Tel Aviv. His work and writing explore the boundaries of interface and the biases of techno-culture as they are redrawn through politics, design and networks. Among Mushon's collaborations, he is the VP of Design at Localize.city - an insight platform merging Urbanism and algorithms; he's the CO-founder of Shual.com - a foxy design studio; YouAreNotHere.org - a tour of Gaza through the streets of Tel Aviv; Kriegspiel - a computer game version of the Situationist Game of War; the Turing Normalizing Machine - exploring algorithmic prejudice; the AdNauseam.io extension - clicking ads so you don't have to; and multiple government transparency and civic participation initiatives with the Public Knowledge Workshop; Mushon also designed the map for Waze.com. Mushon is an alumni of Eyebeam - an art and technology center in New York. He teaches digital media as a senior faculty member at Shenkar School of Engineering and Design. Previously he taught new media research at NYU and Open Source design at Parsons the New School of Design and in Bezalel Academy of Art & Design. Read him at Mushon.com and follow him at @mushon.

name: Guido Brombach
bio: Guido Brombach arbeitet seit 2000 im Bereich Digitale Kommunikation, Lernen und Medien des DGB Bildungswerks. Er konzipiert und führt in diesem Bereich Seminare im Rahmen der politischen Bildung durch. Seit seinem Pädagogik-Studium beschäftigt er sich damit, wie Menschen lernen. In diesem Zusammenhang forscht er über den (bisher) schmalen Pfad an dem sich die analoge und die digitale Welt treffen und welche Möglichkeiten sich daraus für die Bildungspraxis ergeben.

name: Shermin Voshmgir
bio: Shermin is the director of the Research Institute for Crypto Economics at the Vienna University of Economics, and the founder of BlockchainHub. She is also advisor of Jolocom, a blockchain based self sovereign identity protocol and Wunder, a decentralized Art Museum. In the past, she was a curator of The DAO and on the advisory board of the Estonian e-Residency and was. She regularly speaks at conferences and consults on Blockchains and the social impact of future technologies. Shermin did her PhD in IT-Management at the Vienna University of Economics, where she used to work as an assistant professor and currently lectures blockchain related topics. Furthermore she studied film and drama in Madrid. Her past work experience ranges from internet start-ups, IT consulting & filmmaking. Among others her films have screened in Cannes and at dOCUMENTA. Shermin is Austrian with Iranian roots, living between Berlin and Vienna.
links: Twitter, Facebook, BlockchainHub, Berlin, Research Institute for Cryptoeconomics, Vienna University of Economics

name: Barbara Wimmer
bio: Barbara Wimmer ist Netzjournalistin, Buchautorin und Vortragende und lebt in Wien. Sie schreibt und spricht seit mehr als 13 Jahren über IT-Security, Netzpolitik, Datenschutz und Privatsphäre. 2018 wurde sie mit dem Journalistenpreis WINFRA für "herausragende Beiträge des Wiener Infrastruktur-Journalismus” ausgezeichnet. Als Autorin und Vortragende widmete sie sich zuletzt vor allem dem Internet der Dinge. 2018 gab sie eine Science-Fiction-Sammlung mit Kurzgeschichten rund um vermeintlich smarte Gebrauchsgegenstände heraus. Zudem ist sie Jury-Mitglied bei den “Big Brother Awards Austria” sowie Co-Organisatorin des Netzpolitischen Abends in Wien.

name: Takura Zhangazha
bio: Takura Zhangazha is a blogger and human rights activist from Zimbabwe.  His writings focus on human rights and socio-economic justice. He is a keen exponent of African social democratic values.

name: Riad Djemili
bio:
Riad Djemili is the co-founder of Berlin indie game company Maschinen-Mensch. Their debut title The Curious Expedition, a game about fictitious expeditions set in the 19th century, was released in 2015 on Steam Early Access and won the German Developer award for “Best Indie Game 2015”.

Riad started working in the game industry in 2005 and worked for seven years at Berlin game company YAGER, where he among other titles worked on the critically acclaimed game Spec Ops: The Line.

name: Christiane Miethge
bio:
Christiane Miethge beschäftigt sich gerne mit den großen Themen dieses Lebens, zuletzt: die digitale Revolution. Wie verändern Künstliche Intelligenz, Roboter oder digitale Liebhaber uns als Menschen? Wo sind die Grenzen, wo sind die Chancen? Womit wir auch schon bei ihrem neuesten Webprojekt wären: “Homo Digitalis – Wie lange sind wir noch Mensch?” Eine Webserie und ein interaktiver Zukunftstest von BR, ARTE, ORF und dem Fraunhofer Institut.

Zuvor arbeitete Christiane an zahlreichen preisgekrönten, internationalen Webproduktionen wie “Do Not Track” oder “Generation What” mit.

name: Lea Sauer
bio: Lea Sauer. Studium Deutsches Literaturinstitut Leipzig. Promotion in französischer Literaturwissenschaft an der Universität Siegen. U.a. Short List des New Voices Awards der Internationalen PEN-Stiftung, Stipendiatin des 20. Klagenfurter Literaturkurses 2016. Veröffentlichungen u.a. Métro (SuKultur 2015), 971 (BBC Radio 2016), Tippgemeinschaft (2017), Poet (2018).

name: Ronya Othmann
bio: Ronya Othmann ist 1993 in München geboren, wuchs in einer kurdisch-êzîdisch-deutschen Familie in Oberbayern auf und studiert am Deutschen Literaturinstitut in Leipzig. Sie schreibt Lyrik, Prosa, und Essayistisches und ist Teil des Performance-Kollektivs Kaltsignal. 2015 erhielt sie den MDR-Literaturpreis, 2017 den Caroline-Schlegel-Förderpreis für ein Essay und den Open Mike in der Kategorie Lyrik. Sie veröffentlichte in verschiedenen Zeitschriften und Anthologien. Im Herbst 2018 wird ihr erster Lyrikband erscheinen.

name: Jens Balzer
bio: Author and journalist based in Berlin, his latest book is "Pop. Ein Panorama der Gegenwart" (Rowohlt 2016)

name: Luna Ali
bio: Luna Ali – *1993 in Syrien. Studium Kulturwissenschaften und ästhetische Praxis in Hildesheim und Literarisches Schreiben am Deutschen Literaturinstitut in Leipzig. Derzeit Master Anthropology. Nahm 2009 und 2012 am Theatertreffen der Jugend teil. Seit 2012 Kuratorin beim Fuchsbau Festival. 2012 Teilnehmerin am Treffen junger Autoren der Berliner Festspiele 2012.  Jüngste Teilnehmerin des Dramalabors In.Zukunft II 2014 unter Leitung von Maxi Obexer. Zusammenarbeit mit andcompany & co. in Düsseldorf

name: Martin Ehrenhauser
bio: Martin Ehrenhauser, geboren 1978 in Linz, studierte nach seiner abgeschlossenen Kochlehre Betriebswirtschaft und Politikwissenschaften in Österreich und England. Zwischen 2009 und 2014 war er Abgeordneter des Europaparlaments. Heute ist er Unternehmen und Autor. Sein aktuelles Sachbuch: „Die Geldroboter, wie Hochfrequenzmaschinen unser Erspartes einkassieren und Finanzmärkte destabilisieren“. https://goo.gl/gXJ2is

name: Jim Groom
bio: Jim Groom, formerly Executive Director of the Division of Teaching and Learning Technologies at the University of Mary Washington, has been working since 2008 towards the idea of Domain of One‘s Own (a personal domain and web hosting) in order to empower students and faculty to reclaim their online data. In the Spring of 2011 he opened up a digital storytelling course called "ds106" for anyone to take openly online and hundreds of people participated and continue to give back to that community. In Spring of 2013 he joined a group of hackers and thinkers at MIT to think about how an online framework could allow people to seamlessly syndicate the work they do across the web in a space of their own, both on an academic and personal level. Around the same time he co-founded Reclaim Hosting, an independent web hosting company, focused on helping the academic community take control of their online identity. In 2015 he went full-time with Reclaim Hosting and has been working with scores of universities to try and realize the promise of Domain of One's Own.

name: Johnny Haeusler
bio:
Born in Berlin in 1964, Johnny Haeusler worked as a radio DJ, sang with post-punkrock band Plan B (which started playing again occasionally in 2012) and founded the award-winning weblog "Spreeblick" in 2002. He also ran a web design agency and Germany's first blog ad network. Since 2006, he's one of the four founders of re:publica.

In November 2012, Johnny released an internet guide for parents called "Netzgemüse" (the book, not the parents), which he co-wrote with his wife Tanja. From 2012 to 2017, he was back in your radio again, hosting the weekly talkshow FluxFM Spreeblick. All episodes can still be heard here: https://soundcloud.com/fluxfm/sets/spreeblick.

In 2015, Tanja and Johnny started the idea of TINCON, a conference not unlike re:publica, but for teenagers only. Read more about it here: http://tincon.org.

Johnny is the father of two boys.

He is rarely bored.

His highly recommended book of short stories, "I live by the river!", is still available. Unlike this text here, it is written in German.

name: Tanja Haeusler
bio: Co-Founder re:publica & TINCON e.V.

name: Andreas Gebhard
bio: Gründer & Geschäftsführer der re:publica.

name: Markus Beckedahl
bio:
Markus Beckedahl is one of the founders of re:publica. He is also the founder of netzpolitik.org, Germany's most known media outlet on digital rights issues.

He likes thinking about the internet and society.

name: Uwe Pilz
bio: Self-proclaimed bibliophile who believes in the potential of statistics and algorithms to help people find better stuff.

name: Oxana Dubova
bio: After finishing her study in psychology and working in this area for a while in Kostroma (Russia), Oxana moved to Germany to have a new life challenge. She has recently completed the master's degree “Interdisciplinary Latin America Studies" from the Free University of Berlin. During her studies she has also been living in Spain, Portugal and Mexico. Her hobby in Latinamerican dancing led her to be a dance fitness instructor and an event organizer. Her work experience in the Jewish Museum Berlin, educational institutions and various cultural projects helps her to combine organizational and problem solving skills in any event she organizes or participates in. The Oxana's dance fitness classes are full of fun, energy and positive vibes.
